TextJPN: 「さぁて！@k@vS19/03/500300260.　というわけでー！！@k@vS19/03/500300261.　いよいよお昼の時間が来たねぇ！！」
TextENG: ``Okay!@k@vS19/03/500300260. Anyway!!@k@vS19/03/500300261. Lunchtime has finally arrived!!``

TextJPN: 魅音が嬉々としながらお昼の始まりを宣言する。
TextENG: Mion gleefully announced the beginning of lunch.

TextJPN: 「をっほっほっほ！@k@vS19/04/500400317.　いよいよお昼の時間でしてよ～！@k@vS19/04/500400318.　この中のひとりが、罰ゲームになるんですわよねぇ？」
TextENG: ``Oh-ho-ho-ho!@k@vS19/04/500400317. Lunchtime at last~!@k@vS19/04/500400318. Someone here will have to play the punishment game, yes?``

TextJPN: 「はぅ…。@k@vS19/02/500200402.今日の罰ゲームは…ちょっと怖いからね…」
TextENG: ``Hau...@k@vS19/02/500200402. The punishment this time... it's a little scary, so...``

TextJPN: 「レナ、悪いけど、思いっきり真剣に作ってきたよ…！」
TextENG: ``Sorry, but Rena went all out on making her bento...!``

TextJPN: レナの場合は真剣に作らなくても、とりあえず今日の勝負に負けはないと思うがな…。
TextENG: In Rena's case, I don't think she'd lose even if she wasn't taking it seriously...

TextJPN: 「……みー。@k@vS19/05/500500163.ボクたちもそれぞれに頑張りましたのですよ」
TextENG: ``...Meep.@k@vS19/05/500500163. We tried our hardest too.``

TextJPN: 「今日は沙都子も梨花ちゃんも、それぞれに別々に作ってきた？@k@vS19/03/500300263.　いつもは二人一緒のお弁当だけど、今日は一緒だと勝負にならないからねぇ」
TextENG: ``Satoko and Rika-chan made separate lunches today?@k@vS19/03/500300263. Usually you have the same bento, but that won't do for the showdown today, will it?``

TextJPN: 「えぇ。@k@vS19/04/500400320.そこは大丈夫ですのよ。@k@vS19/04/500400321.梨花も私もちゃんとそれぞれに用意させていただきましたのよ」
TextENG: ``Yes.@k@vS19/04/500400320. It's quite all right.@k@vS19/04/500400321. Rika and I made sure to make separate ones.``

TextJPN: 「わー、沙都子ちゃんも梨花ちゃんもがんばったんだね！@k@vS19/02/500200405.　楽しみ楽しみ！」
TextENG: ``Wow, Satoko-chan and Rika-chan both tried really hard!@k@vS19/02/500200405. How exciting!``

TextJPN: 「…ちょっと意外だったのは、圭ちゃんがちゃんとお弁当を用意できた点かな！@k@vS19/03/500300265.　圭ちゃんも、さすが！@k@vS19/03/500300266.　やればできるみたいじゃない！」
TextENG: ``...What's a little surprising is that Kei-chan was able to make a bento!@k@vS19/03/500300265. Good job, Kei-chan!@k@vS19/03/500300266. It looks like you really can do it if you try!``

TextJPN: 苦笑いしながら頭を掻く。
TextENG: I scratched my head and gave her a dry smile.

TextJPN: …今日のお弁当は全部、昨夜の沙都子のお膳立てだ。
TextENG: ...My bento today had been made entirely by Satoko last night.

TextJPN: 俺なりのオリジナリティなど一切ない。@kだから俺が褒められるようなことは何もない。
TextENG: It had none of my personality.@k So there wasn't anything there that they could praise me for.

TextJPN: 「圭一くんのお弁当はどんなだろ！@k@vS19/02/500200407.　はぅ、楽しみ！」
TextENG: ``What does Keiichi-kun's bento look like?@k@vS19/02/500200407. Hau, I can't wait to see!``

TextJPN: 「そんな大したものじゃないから期待するなよ…。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25440.昨夜のご飯のお惣菜の残りが詰めてあるだけだし…」
TextENG: ``Don't expect too much...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25440. It's just the leftover rice and side dishes from last night...``

TextJPN: 「……お夕食の残り物は、お弁当の基本なのですよ」
TextENG: ``...Leftovers are the foundation of bentos.``

TextJPN: 「をっほっほっほ！@k@vS19/04/500400323.　昨夜の圭一さんのお夕食もわかって一石二鳥ですわねぇ！」
TextENG: ``Oh-ho-ho-ho!@k@vS19/04/500400323. Now we'll know your dinner last night too—we'll kill two birds with one stone!``

TextJPN: …昨夜、沙都子がうちに作りに来てくれたことは内緒にしておいた方がいいのかな…？
TextENG: ...Was it really better to hide the fact that Satoko came over and made dinner last night...?

TextJPN: そりゃ内緒にしておいた方がいいよな。
TextENG: Well, of course it was.

TextJPN: …このお弁当が自力で作ったものじゃないとバレたら、その時点で罰ゲーム確定だ。
TextENG: ...If I revealed that I didn't make my own bento, I'd be sure to end up playing the punishment game.

TextJPN: 今日の罰ゲームは……、別名『カレーファイター』の知恵先生の真ん前で、カレーの悪口を言うこと！
TextENG: Today's punishment game... was to stand right in front of the curry maniac Chie-sensei and say bad things about curry!

TextJPN: それは百階建てのビルの屋上から飛び降りろという罰ゲームとそんなに大差ない。
TextENG: It wasn't too different from telling someone to jump out of a hundredth-story window.

TextJPN: …死ねと言ってるのとまったく同じだからだ…！
TextENG: ...It was exactly the same as telling someone to die...!

TextJPN: 「でも魅ぃちゃん。@k@vS19/02/500200409.…今日のお弁当勝負ってどうやって勝敗をつけるのかな？@k@vS19/02/500200410.　圭一くんもちゃんと作ってこれたんだから、今日はこれで引き分けで決着なんじゃないのかな？」
TextENG: ``But Mii-chan...@k@vS19/02/500200409. How will we decide who wins and loses the bento showdown?@k@vS19/02/500200410. Keiichi-kun made his own too, so maybe we should call it a draw for today?``

TextJPN: 「…それもそうですわね。@k@vS19/04/500400325.昨日の罰ゲームは、圭一さんに自炊を促すための発破みたいなものですし」
TextENG: ``...We could do that.@k@vS19/04/500400325. The punishment game yesterday was sort of a whip to encourage Keiichi-san to cook for himself, after all.``

TextJPN: 「……圭一もちゃんと作って来れましたから、引き分けなのですよ」
TextENG: ``...And Keiichi made his own too, so it's a draw.``

TextJPN: 勝つべくして作ったみんなの弁当と、昨夜の残り物を詰めてきただけの俺のお弁当とじゃ、初めから勝負にならないもんな…。
TextENG: My simple bento with last night's leftovers could never have stood up to everyone else's bento that they made to win...

TextJPN: 沙都子と梨花ちゃんの、穏便に勝負を終わらせようとする心遣いがよくわかる。
TextENG: I fully understood Satoko and Rika-chan's concern for me as they tried to end the showdown peaceably.

TextJPN: …だが！@k　部長、園崎魅音がそんなことで納得するわけがなかった…！！
TextENG: ...However!@k The club president, Mion Sonozaki, would not be convinced by something like that...!!

TextJPN: 「なぁにを甘っちょろいこと言ってるんだか！@k@vS19/03/500300268.　シロクロつけない灰色勝負なんて絶対御免！！@k@vS19/03/500300269.　ぶつかったら決着つけなきゃ！@k@vS19/03/500300270.　手打ちして引き分けなんて、遊びでやってんじゃないんだよぉぉっ！」
TextENG: ``I wonder why you're all so optimistic!@k@vS19/03/500300268. Leaving one of our showdowns in such a grey area is out of the question!!@k@vS19/03/500300269. Now that we've clashed, we must settle the score!@k@vS19/03/500300270. Reconciling with a draw? Do you think we're just kidding around!?``

TextJPN: 「い、言うと思ったぜ……。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25460.勝負好きの魅音が、このまま終わらせるわけないよな…」
TextENG: ``I-I knew you'd say that...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25460. There's no way you'd end it that way, with your battle lust...``

TextJPN: まずいな…。
TextENG: This was bad...

TextJPN: …このままじゃ…俺の一人負けは確実だ。
TextENG: ...At this rate... I was sure to be the sole loser.

TextJPN: …でもまぁ…確かに俺が自分で作った弁当じゃないし……。
TextENG: ...But, well... I didn't make this bento, after all...

TextJPN: …負けは…甘んじて受けねばならないのかな……。
TextENG: ...Maybe... I need to resign myself to my inevitable loss...

TextJPN: 「……では魅ぃ。@k@vS19/05/500500167.どうやって勝敗を決めますですか？」
TextENG: ``...Okay, Mii.@k@vS19/05/500500167. How are we going to decide who wins?``

TextJPN: 「相互採点じゃあ、公平な採点にならないからね」
TextENG: ``It won't be fair if we grade each other's.``

TextJPN: 「ここは公開審査と行こうじゃない！@k@vS19/03/500300273.　ヘイ、みんなぁ！！@k@vS19/03/500300274.　全員集合～ッ！！」
TextENG: ``Let's do an open judgment!@k@vS19/03/500300273. Okay, everyone!!@k@vS19/03/500300274. Assemble~!!``

TextJPN: 魅音が委員長ボイスで、食事を始めたばかりのみんなに号令する。
TextENG: Mion commanded everyone, who had just started eating, using her club president voice.

TextJPN: 「おじさんたち５人のお弁当を採点してもらうよ！！@k@vS19/03/500300276.　ベスト３までを紙に書いて投票すること！@k@vS19/03/500300277.　いいかな？！」
TextENG: ``Come and judge our five bento!!@k@vS19/03/500300276. Write your favorite three on a piece of paper and submit it!@k@vS19/03/500300277. Understand?!``

TextJPN: クラスのみんなも、魅音の部活に巻き込まれることには慣れている。@kおおぉー！@k　と元気のいい声があちこちから上がった。
TextENG: Everyone in the class was used to being dragged into Mion's club activities.@k Yeeaah!@k came the energetic voices from here and there.

TextJPN: …今日の勝負の、あまりに致命的な罰ゲームはすでにみんなの知るところであり、@k…みんなとしても、敗者がどのような末路を辿るのか興味津々なのだ。
TextENG: ...Everyone already knew that the showdown this time involved an utterly fatal punishment game...@k and they were all very interested in what would happen to whoever lost.

TextJPN: ……もちろん、怖いもの見たさという意味で！
TextENG: ...Of course, they wanted the thrill of seeing something terrifying!
``Okay... Everyone ready?!@k@vS19/03/500300279. Then I'll go first, all right?!@k@vS19/03/500300280. Ta-daah!!``

TextJPN: 魅音が重箱のような立派な弁当箱のフタを、大仰に開けて見せた。
TextENG: In exaggerated fashion, Mion pulled the lid off her multi-tiered, ornate bento box.

TextJPN: 絢爛な弁当の数々に歓声があがる…！！
TextENG: Multiple cheers of joy erupted at the brilliant sight...!!

TextJPN: 「す、すごいですわねぇ！！@k@vS19/04/500400327.　おせち料理みたいでしてよ？！」
TextENG: ``T-That's amazing!!@k@vS19/04/500400327. It's just like New Year's food!``

TextJPN: 「嘘だ…。嘘に決まってる。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25480.こんなのどこかの仕出し弁当の中身を移し変えただけに違いない。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25490.こんな純日本風な料理を魅音が！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25500.　魅音が！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25510.　あの園崎魅音が作れるわけがなぁいいい！！！」
TextENG: ``It can't be... It has to be a lie.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25480. She must have switched the contents with a catered bento.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25490. Such purely Japanese cooking...!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25500. Mion!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25510. Mion Sonozaki couldn't possibly make this!!!``

TextJPN: 「うぅん…、魅ぃちゃん、このくらいは本気になれば作れるよ…。@k@vS19/02/500200412.滅多に本気にならないけど…」
TextENG: ``Nope... This is easy for Mii-chan if she gets serious...@k@vS19/02/500200412. She almost never gets serious though...``

TextJPN: 「くっくっく…！@k@vS19/03/500300282.　おじさんを誰だと思ってるわけぇ？@k@vS19/03/500300283.　時間と材料があるなら、満漢全席だって再現してみせるよー？　くっくっく！」
TextENG: ``Ku-ku-ku...!@k@vS19/03/500300282. Just who do you think this old man is?@k@vS19/03/500300283. Given enough time and ingredients, I could even reproduce the Manchu Han Imperial Feast! Ku-ku-ku!``

TextJPN: 教室中が、ごくりと喉を鳴らす。
TextENG: The entire classroom gulped audibly.

TextJPN: …そしてみんな一斉に手元のメモ紙に点数を記入する。
TextENG: ...And everyone wrote down a score on the notepaper in their hands simultaneously.

TextJPN: そりゃそうだ。@k見た目のインパクトなら百点満点だからな…！
TextENG: It made sense.@k Just the visual impact would give her a perfect score...!

TextJPN: 「じゃあ、次はレナのお弁当、行ってみようか！@k@vS19/03/500300285.　レナもかなり料理は得意だからねぇ！」
TextENG: ``All right, let's see Rena's next!@k@vS19/03/500300285. Rena's really good at cooking too!``

TextJPN: 「……レナのお弁当はいつも食卓の華なのですよ」
TextENG: ``...Rena's bento is always like a flower arrangement.``

TextJPN: 「あはははははは！@k@vS19/02/500200414.　みんなありがとね！@k@vS19/02/500200415.　じゃあレナのお弁当も公開するね。@k@vS19/02/500200416.え～い☆」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha!@k@vS19/02/500200414. Thanks, everyone!@k@vS19/02/500200415. I'll reveal my bento now.@k@vS19/02/500200416. Eeii~☆.``

TextJPN: レナの弁当は……、
TextENG: Rena's bento...

TextJPN: 卵とそぼろの二色が美しい…これまたお弁当の定番、@kそぼろ弁当だ！
TextENG: ...was a beautiful mix of the two colors of eggs and minced meat... and it, too, was a bento staple,@k the soboro bento!

TextJPN: おかずも丁寧に作られていて品数も豊富。
TextENG: She had been thorough with the side dishes as well, and they were abundant in number.

TextJPN: …いつも以上に手間がかけられているけど、それは肩肘を張ったものでない、実にさり気ないものだ。
TextENG: ...She had spent more time than usual on it, but it was unassuming and truly nonchalant.

TextJPN: 魅音の弁当と違い、家庭的な温かさがある点も見逃せない。
TextENG: One couldn't ignore the household warmth in it that Mion's bento lacked.

TextJPN: 「…さすが…ですわね！@k@vS19/04/500400329.　これは…高得点が期待できましてよ！」
TextENG: ``...If I may say... you've done it again!@k@vS19/04/500400329. This... should get quite a high score!``

TextJPN: 「……さぁすがぁ。@k@vS19/03/500300287.厳しめに見ても、減点の余地はまったくないね。@k@vS19/03/500300288.…相変わらず見事！」
TextENG: ``...I should have known.@k@vS19/03/500300287. It may look rigid, but there isn't anything to deduct points from.@k@vS19/03/500300288. ...Amazing as always!``

TextJPN: 今度もまた、審査員一同が一斉にメモ紙に点数を記入している。
TextENG: Once again, every one of the judges wrote a score on their note paper at the same time.

TextJPN: さっきの魅音の点数と比べ、評価を改めている人もいるみたいだ。
TextENG: There seemed to be some who were revising their opinions when they compared it to Mion's score, too.

TextJPN: …教室全体が、魅音派とレナ派にわかれているみたいだな。
TextENG: ...The whole classroom seemed split between Mion and Rena.

TextJPN: 誰の顔にも、採点より味見がしたい…！@k　と書かれているのがよくわかる。
TextENG: And on everyone's face, it was clear...@k that they all wanted to be tasting them, rather than scoring them!

TextJPN: 「……では、続いてボクたちなのです」
TextENG: ``...Then we'll be next.``

TextJPN: 「えぇ！@k@vS19/04/500400331.　では、公開するでございますわよー！！」
TextENG: ``Yes!@k@vS19/04/500400331. I will now reveal mine!!``

TextJPN: そう言えば…。
TextENG: Come to think of it...

TextJPN: 沙都子と梨花ちゃんは、昨夜はうちに来てみんなで食事をしたんだよな…。
TextENG: Satoko and Rika-chan ate with me last night at my house...

TextJPN: それでよくお弁当を用意できたものだ…。
TextENG: It was impressive that they still made a bento...

TextJPN: ２人のお弁当箱の中身は……、魅音の芸術性、レナの完璧さに比べると明らかに見劣るものだった。
TextENG: Both their bentos... were clearly lacking compared to Mion's artfulness and Rena's perfection.

TextJPN: …だが、……それゆえの精一杯感は伝わってくる。
TextENG: ...However... because of that, you could sense from them how hard they worked.

TextJPN: 盛り込みのちょっと粗いところなどが、…精一杯がんばりましたですよ…という感じがして、@k何だかちょっと贔屓目に採点してあげたくなる心情にさせられる。
TextENG: The toppings were a little on the rough side... but you could still feel... that they tried their hardest.@k It made you feel a little biased, so that you'd give them more points.

TextJPN: そのあたりに心打たれた何人かが、またしても評価を改め、メモ紙に点数を書き込んでいた。
TextENG: A few people struck by just that once again revised their opinions and wrote in scores on their note paper.

TextJPN: 「……沙都子も梨花ちゃんも。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25530.…よく今日のお弁当を用意できたもんだな…。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25540.レナや魅音の出来には確かに劣るかもしれないけど…、それを考えるとかなりすごいことだぜ…」
TextENG: ``...Satoko, Rika-chan...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25530. You both made really good bentos today...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25540. They might not measure up to Rena or Mion's craftsmanship... But when you think about that, they're pretty amazing...``

TextJPN: 沙都子と梨花ちゃんが顔を見合わせてニマ～と笑う。
TextENG: Satoko and Rika-chan glanced at each other and grinned happily.

TextJPN: 「実は…内緒でございますのよ…？@k@vS19/04/500400333.　ごにょごにょ」
TextENG: ``This... is a secret, okay...?@k@vS19/04/500400333. Mutter mutter.``

TextJPN: 沙都子にネタを教えられ、俺はみんなの輪を抜け出し…こっそり、クラスメイトの弁当箱を探す。
TextENG: When Satoko told me, I broke off from the others... and secretly looked for my classmates' bento boxes.

TextJPN: ……あった、富田くんと岡村くんの弁当箱！
TextENG: ...There—Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun's bento boxes!

TextJPN: 中をそっと覗き込むと……。
TextENG: I took a quick peek inside, and...

TextJPN: あぁぁ！！
TextENG: Ahhh!!

TextJPN: 中身が半分ないッ！！！@k　や、やるなぁ！！
TextENG: Half of the contents were missing!!!@k N-Not bad!!

TextJPN: 結局、沙都子と梨花ちゃんは今日のお弁当を用意できなかったので……@k富田くんと岡村くんに弁当をわけてもらうという大技に出たわけかぁ！！
TextENG: In the end, Satoko and Rika-chan hadn't made bento today...@k A bold move—they got Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun to share their bentos with them!!

TextJPN: 「…おい、富田くん、岡村くん。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25560.…何を条件に買収された」
TextENG: ``...Hey, Tomita-kun, Okamura-kun...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25560. How did they buy you out?``

TextJPN: 「いいいいい、いきなり何ですか前原さん？！@k@vS19/24/502400015.　わわわわ、私たちがいつ何を買収されたって言うんですか？！」
TextENG: ``W-W-W-W-W-W-What are you saying, Maebara-san?!@k@vS19/24/502400015. W-W-W-W-W-When did we get bought out, and for what?!``

TextJPN: 「そそそ、そうっすよ…！@k@vS19/25/502500014.　別に沙都子たちに水やり当番を代わってもらうくらいで弁当を半分なんか…！！」
TextENG: ``T-T-T-That's right...!@k@vS19/25/502500014. It's not like we traded them our duty watering the garden for half our bentos...!!``

TextJPN: ……沙都子めぇ。
TextENG: ...Curse you, Satoko.

TextJPN: 小癪な手を使うようになりやがってぇ…！
TextENG: What an impudent trick...!

TextJPN: 沙都子がニヤリと八重歯を見せながら得意げに笑う。
TextENG: Satoko grinned, showing her fang-like canines, and laughed in triumph.

TextJPN: 「あぁら、これは圭一さんに学ばせてもらったワザですのよ？@k@vS19/04/500400335.　をっほっほっほ！」
TextENG: ``Oh, this is only something I learned from you, Keiichi-san!@k@vS19/04/500400335. Oh-ho-ho-ho!``

TextJPN: 「……おっほっほー、なのです」
TextENG: ``...Yes, oh-ho-ho.``

TextJPN: ふふん、水やり当番程度で買収じゃあ底が浅いぜ…。
TextENG: Heh, how naive—buying them out with watering duty alone.

TextJPN: いいか、男を買収しようとしたら、もっともっと熱いのじゃないとダメなんだよ！！
TextENG: They're men—if you're going to buy them out, you need to use something a lot spicier than that!!

TextJPN: たとえば……う～ん、
TextENG: For example... hmm.

TextJPN: ……沙都子と梨花ちゃんが、四つん這いの尻尾付き、首輪に首ヒモ付きでの一日お散歩券が三枚くらいとか。@k……ぅおおぉおぉ、こ、これなら…俺も買収されたいかもッ？！？！
TextENG: ...Like giving them three tickets to walk Satoko and Rika-chan around like dogs all day, with them on all fours, wearing tails, and with leashes around their necks.@k ...Whoaaaa, t-that would... That might be enough to get me to do anything?!?!

TextJPN: …なんて妄想を頭いっぱいにしているところを、魅音に肩を叩かれ、現実に呼び戻された。@k（ちぇ、いいところだったのにぃ…！）
TextENG: ...As I was lost in my wild fantasies, Mion clapped me on the shoulder and called me back to reality.@k (Damn, it was just getting good...!)

TextJPN: 「さぁて！！@k@vS19/03/500300290.　次はいよいよ圭ちゃんのお弁当だねー！！@k@vS19/03/500300291.　圭ちゃんの昨日の予告だと、かなりのものが期待されるけど…実際はどうなのかなぁ？！」
TextENG: ``All right!!@k@vS19/03/500300290. Next up is Kei-chan's bento!!@k@vS19/03/500300291. We're all hoping for something pretty great because of your declaration yesterday... but how did it really turn out?!``

TextJPN: 「圭一くんって、やる時にはやる人だからね！@k@vS19/02/500200418.　レナ、今日はとっても楽しみにしてたんだよ。だよ！」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun can do it if he needs to!@k@vS19/02/500200418. Rena was really excited for today. Today!``

TextJPN: ……ぅぅ、期待なんかされても……。
TextENG: ...Urgh, they're all looking forward to it...

TextJPN: 結局…、昨夜の晩飯を詰めてきただけ。
TextENG: But... it's really just leftovers from dinner last night.

TextJPN: しかもそれは俺が作った飯ですらない。
TextENG: I didn't even make it, either.

TextJPN: …そんなのが魅音やレナたちの弁当にどう太刀打ちできるって言うんだよ…。
TextENG: ...How was that supposed to stand up to Mion and Rena and the others...?

TextJPN: 「えぇい、もうヤケだー！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25580.　見て驚くなよー！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25590.　えぇーーい！！」
TextENG: ``Argh, that's it!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25580. Feast your eyes on this!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25590. Haahhh!!``

TextJPN: カパーーーンと弁当箱の蓋を開く。
TextENG: I tore the lid off my bento box.

TextJPN: ……みんなの歓声はそんなになかった。@k…まぁ、そりゃそうだよな…。
TextENG: ...There weren't very many cheers.@k ...Well, I guess there wouldn't be...

TextJPN: 「あはははは！@k@vS19/02/500200420.　圭一くんも精一杯、がんばったんだね！@k@vS19/02/500200421.　レナはそのがんばり、わかるよ」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha!@k@vS19/02/500200420. Keiichi-kun, you tried your hardest too!@k@vS19/02/500200421. Rena can tell how hard you worked.``

TextJPN: 「レナ…。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25610.無理に褒めなくていいぞ…」
TextENG: ``Rena...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25610. Don't feel like you need to compliment me...``

TextJPN: 「えっと、…どんな具合ですの？@k@vS19/04/500400337.　圭一さんにしては頑張ってる方ですの…？」
TextENG: ``Umm... How did this happen?@k@vS19/04/500400337. Was Keiichi-san actually a hard worker after all...?``

TextJPN: 「くっくっくっく！@k@vS19/03/500300293.　まぁその、…がんばりは認めてあげたいけどねぇ…。@k@vS19/03/500300294.勝負は非情だしね。@k@vS19/03/500300295.くっくっくっく！」
TextENG: ``Ku-ku-ku-ku!@k@vS19/03/500300293. Well, I mean... I want to acknowledge how hard you tried, but...@k@vS19/03/500300294. For this showdown, it doesn't matter.@k@vS19/03/500300295. Ku-ku-ku-ku!``

TextJPN: 魅音の嫌味な冷笑…！@k　それはそのままみんなの評価を代弁するかのようだった。
TextENG: Mion's cold, mean laugh...!@k It was like it spoke for everyone's opinion, just like that.

TextJPN: 「う、…うーん…。@k@vS19/02/500200423.圭一くん、初挑戦なのにこんなに上手に作れたんだよ？@k@vS19/02/500200424.　みんなもっともっと評価してあげてもいいと思うんだけどな…」
TextENG: ``Um... Hmm...@k@vS19/02/500200423. Keiichi-kun did really well considering it was his first challenge, you know?@k@vS19/02/500200424. I think maybe everyone should rate his a little higher...``

TextJPN: 「……でも、勝負は非情なのです」
TextENG: ``...But for the showdown, it doesn't matter.``

TextJPN: 「くっくっくっく…。@k@vS19/03/500300297.さぁて圭ちゃん。@k@vS19/03/500300298.採点結果を集計する前に、何か申開きがあるなら聞いておくけどぉ？@k@vS19/03/990300159.　くっくっく！」
TextENG: ``Ku-ku-ku-ku...@k@vS19/03/500300297. All right, Kei-chan.@k@vS19/03/500300298. If you have any last words before we tally up the results, I'll listen to them now.@k@vS19/03/990300159. Ku-ku-ku!``

TextJPN: 「も、…申開きって何だよ」
TextENG: ``W...What do you mean by last words?``

TextJPN: 「圭ちゃんがここで何かを訴えることで、わずかな得点加算が望めるかもしれないってこと」
TextENG: ``I mean that you might be hoping for a few extra points if you appeal somehow to the crowd.``

TextJPN: 「…くっくっく！@k@vS19/03/500300302.　何しろ今日の勝負はビリでさえなければいいんだから。@k@vS19/03/500300303.うまくすれば…何とか罰ゲームから逃れることができるかもよ？」
TextENG: ``...Ku-ku-ku!@k@vS19/03/500300302. After all, for today's showdown, you just need to avoid coming in last.@k@vS19/03/500300303. If you do well enough... then maybe you'll be able to worm out of the punishment game.``

TextJPN: 「をっほっほっほ！@k@vS19/04/500400339.　それって暗に、圭一さんのお弁当がビリって言ってるのと同じことでしてよー？」
TextENG: ``Oh-ho-ho-ho!@k@vS19/04/500400339. You are implying that Keiichi-san's bento is going to take last place, aren't you?``

TextJPN: 「別におじさん、誰の弁当がビリなんて言ったつもりはないんだけどなぁ。@k@vS19/03/500300305.くっくっく！」
TextENG: ``No, this old man wasn't trying to say anyone's bento came in last or anything.@k@vS19/03/500300305. Ku-ku-ku!``

TextJPN: 魅音が嫌らしそうにゲテゲテと笑った。
TextENG: Mion cackled repulsively.

TextJPN: …それとは対照的に、沙都子の笑顔はどことなくぎこちなくなっていく。
TextENG: ...In contrast, Satoko's smile was growing somehow awkward.

TextJPN: ……そうだ。
TextENG: ...Oh, right.

TextJPN: この弁当は昨夜のおかずを詰めてきたもの。@k…つまりは、沙都子が作った弁当も同然なのだ。
TextENG: This bento was filled with last night's side dishes.@k ...That means it was basically a bento that Satoko made.

TextJPN: それを、魅音にはっきりとビリと言われてしまった…。
TextENG: And Mion outright said it would come in last place...

TextJPN: 「魅ぃちゃん、ちょっといじわるだよ？@k@vS19/02/500200426.　圭一くんがかわいそう」
TextENG: ``Mii-chan, aren't you being a little mean?@k@vS19/02/500200426. Poor Keiichi-kun.``

TextJPN: 「レナぁ。@k@vS19/03/500300307.圭ちゃんも、今日の弁当勝負は負けられないって予め知ってたんだよ？@k@vS19/03/500300308.　それを承知で昨日あれだけの大見得を切ったんだからさ。@k@vS19/03/500300309.甘やかす必要なんて全然ないと思うけどなぁ？」
TextENG: ``Rena...@k@vS19/03/500300307. Kei-chan knew he couldn't lose today's bento showdown beforehand, didn't he?@k@vS19/03/500300308. He did all that grandstanding yesterday, well aware of that.@k@vS19/03/500300309. I don't think there's any reason to go easy on him, do you?``

TextJPN: 「ねぇ沙都子？」
TextENG: ``Right, Satoko?``

TextJPN: 「え、……えぇ！@k@vS19/04/500400341.　そうですわね！@k@vS19/04/500400342.　それでこのザマなんですから笑っちゃいましてよ？@k@vS19/04/500400343.　をーっほっほっほ！」
TextENG: ``Y... Yes!@k@vS19/04/500400341. You are right!@k@vS19/04/500400342. And he came here with this mess—it makes me laugh!@k@vS19/04/500400343. Ohh-ho-ho-ho!``

TextJPN: 「…ちょっと沙都子ちゃん！@k@vS19/02/500200428.　笑うなんていけないんだよ」
TextENG: ``...Wait, Satoko-chan!@k@vS19/02/500200428. You can't laugh at him.``

TextJPN: 「だって、ちゃんちゃらおかしくって笑ってしまうようなお弁当でしてよ？」
TextENG: ``But that bento is just so ridiculous I can't help but laugh!``

TextJPN: 「こんな、お惣菜屋さんで買ってきたようなおかず、本当に幻滅もいいところでしてよー？」
TextENG: ``These side dishes look like they were bought from a shop—it's really disillusioning!``

TextJPN: 「ほら、これなんか缶詰を開けただけだよね？@k@vS19/03/500300312.　こっちのキュウリは包丁が通ってなくて綺麗に切れてないし～。@k@vS19/03/500300313.圭ちゃん、包丁とか全然扱ったことないでしょ。@k@vS19/03/500300314.経験不足が明らかなんだよねぇ」
TextENG: ``Look, this one was just taken out of a can, wasn't it?@k@vS19/03/500300312. This cucumber here isn't cut cleanly, like the knife didn't go all the way through~@k@vS19/03/500300313. Kei-chan, you never used a knife, did you?@k@vS19/03/500300314. Your lack of experience is apparent.``

TextJPN: 「…えぇえぇ、経験不足もいいところでございましてよー？」
TextENG: ``...Nooo, this goes beyond a simple lack of experience!``

TextJPN: 「彩りもかなり単調。@k@vS19/03/500300316.こればかりはセンスのなさに呆れるねぇ！@k@vS19/03/500300317.　あっはっはっは！」
TextENG: ``The presentation is fairly monotonous as well.@k@vS19/03/500300316. It's almost a shock to see such a lack of taste!@k@vS19/03/500300317. Ah-ha-ha-ha!``

TextJPN: 「う、…そ、そりゃあ弁当箱に食い物を詰めるなんて初めての経験だし…、@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25640.多少見栄えが悪いのは仕方が…」
TextENG: ``Urk... I-It was my first experience putting food into a bento box, so...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25640. Of course it's not going to look too good...``
``Kei-chan, Kei-chan.@k@vS19/03/500300319. There's a bigger problem than how you put it into the box!@k@vS19/03/500300320. Tomita, Okamura.@k@vS19/03/500300321. Explain please~``

TextJPN: 後輩の富田くんと岡村くんに白羽の矢が立つ。
TextENG: Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun were chosen from our many underclassmen.

TextJPN: 富田くんはメガネをくっと直してから、一歩前に出た。
TextENG: Tomita-kun quickly adjusted his glasses and took a step forward.

TextJPN: 「前原さんのお弁当に致命的な欠点。@k@vS19/24/502400017.それは彩りなんです。@k@vS19/24/502400018.ご存じの通り、あらゆる色彩の根底には三原色と呼ばれる配色が存在します。@k@vS19/24/502400019.つまり、バランスよく配色を求めるなら白黒を除いても三色は必要なのです」
TextENG: ``The fatal flaw in Maebara-san's bento.@k@vS19/24/502400017. It's the coloration.@k@vS19/24/502400018. As you know, there are three primary colors forming the basis of all colors.@k@vS19/24/502400019. So if you want a well-balanced color scheme, then excluding white and black, you need those three colors.``

TextJPN: 「えー、然るに。@k@vS19/25/502500016.前原さんのお弁当は白黒を除いた場合、暗緑色しか残らないんですよ」
TextENG: ``And, nevertheless.@k@vS19/25/502500016. If you removed the white and black from Maebara-san's bento, all that would be left is dark green.``

TextJPN: あ、暗緑色…。
TextENG: Ah, dark green...

TextJPN: 何とも食欲をそそらない言い方をしおって…。
TextENG: No one will want to eat it if you describe it like that...

TextJPN: …忘れてた。
TextENG: ...I had forgotten.

TextJPN: 富田くんと岡村くんは、梨花ちゃんたちに買収されてるから、彼女らを勝たせるために全力で俺を負かそうとしてきてるんだよな。
TextENG: Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun had been bought out by Rika-chan and Satoko, so they were trying their hardest to let them win and make me lose, weren't they?

TextJPN: …ぐ、たくましいヤツらだ。
TextENG: ...Gah, what strong wills they have.

TextJPN: 買収された分、きっちり働いてるのだけは微笑ましい。
TextENG: It was charming if only because they were working so hard despite having been bought out.

TextJPN: 「おかずも心のこもらない、お惣菜や缶詰ばかり」
TextENG: ``The side dishes have no spirit in them either—they're all prepackaged or canned food.``

TextJPN: 「つまり前原さんのお弁当には、お弁当の三大要素！@k@vS19/24/502400021.　愛・心・味の内、２つも欠けていると断言できるのです！！」
TextENG: ``In other words, out of the three necessary requirements for a bento:@k@vS19/24/502400021. love, spirit, and taste, we can assert that Maebara-san's bento is lacking two of these!!``

TextJPN: クラス中が、何だかすっかり煙に巻かれたナゾ解説で何となく納得し、おおぉぉ…とナゾの歓声をあげる。
TextENG: The classroom, convinced by the elucidation of the mystery they were thoroughly baffled with, raised mysterious groans of admiration.
``...Ku-ku-ku!@k@vS19/03/990300440. No heart, and no spirit.@k@vS19/03/990300441. It's decided, then?@k@vS19/03/990300442. Keiichi Maebara!!``

TextJPN: 「うーん…」
「ちょっと冷たいけど…、…でもこれを機に、圭一くんもお料理の楽しさに気付いてくれれば…いいのかな？　かな？」
TextENG: ``This may sound cold... But if you realized how much fun cooking is because of all this, Keiichi-kun... isn't that enough? Enough?``

TextJPN: 「……そんなことより、罰ゲームがボク以外なら何でもいいのですよ」
TextENG: ``...In any case, everything is fine as long as I'm not doing the punishment game.``

TextJPN: レナも、えへへ♪　…と苦笑する。
TextENG: Rena was giving a dry, ``ehehe♪`` smile as well.

TextJPN: 「をっほっほっほ！！@k@vS19/04/500400348.　決まりましたわね圭一さん！@k@vS19/04/500400349.　罰ゲームは圭一さんで決まりですのよー！！@k@vS19/04/500400350.　をーっほっほっほっほ…！」
TextENG: ``Oh-ho-ho-ho!!@k@vS19/04/500400348. It's been settled, Keiichi-san!@k@vS19/04/500400349. You're going to be the one doing the punishment game!!@k@vS19/04/500400350. Ohh-ho-ho-ho-ho...!``

TextJPN: 憎々しげに笑って見せるが、…とてもそうは見えない。
TextENG: She laughed in such a vile manner... but she didn't look like she meant it.

TextJPN: 教室中に、自分が作ったも同然の弁当を@bけな.@<貶@>されたことを知っている俺には、沙都子の笑顔がどれだけ痛ましいものかよくわかった。
TextENG: I knew that Satoko was speaking ill of a bento that she'd practically made herself in front of the whole classroom, and I could tell how painful that laughter was.

TextJPN: …………さっき岡村くんは、この弁当に心がないといったが。
TextENG: ......Okamura-kun said before that this bento lacked spirit.

TextJPN: …今日この場に広げられた弁当の中で、この弁当ほど心のこもったものなどあるものか。
TextENG: ...But among all the bento laid out here today, there wasn't a single one with as much spirit as this one.

TextJPN: 昨日、…あんなにも上機嫌に（見た目はすごく不機嫌そうだったけど…）作ってくれた料理が、…このまま@bけな.@<貶@>されて終わってなるものか……！
TextENG: This meal... that she made for me yesterday in such a good mood (though it looked like she was in a bad one)... I won't let it end with this slander...!

TextJPN: 「さぁて！@k@vS19/04/500400352.　ビリの圭一さん？！@k@vS19/04/500400353.　そろそろ大人しく負けを認めなさいませー！！」
TextENG: ``Well then!@k@vS19/04/500400352. Last place, Keiichi-san?!@k@vS19/04/500400353. Please, admit your honest defeat already!!``

TextJPN: 「……ちょっと待ってもらおうか」
TextENG: ``...Could you wait just a moment?``

TextJPN: 俺が低い声を出した時、部活メンバーの目つきがかわった。
TextENG: When I began to speak in a low voice, the expressions of all the members of the club changed.

TextJPN: 魅音が舌を打つ。
TextENG: Mion clicked her tongue.

TextJPN: …この男、やはり土壇場で牙を剥いたか…！
TextENG: ...This man was bearing his fangs at the last moment again...!

TextJPN: 「俺の弁当の敗因は心がないから。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25670.そういう解説だったな。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25680.間違いないな、岡村くん」
TextENG: ``My bento was defeated because it lacked spirit.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25670. That's how you explained it.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25680. Am I wrong, Okamura-kun?``

TextJPN: 突然、矛先を向けられた岡村くんは一瞬焦ったが、すぐにどもりながらそうだと返事した。
TextENG: Okamura-kun, who had suddenly been placed in the spotlight, looked flustered for a moment, but immediately, he stammered in reply that I was right.

TextJPN: 「心の定義はなんだ。苦労か？@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25700.　努力か？@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25710.　汗か涙か？@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25720.　その結晶か？！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25730.　…ならば、俺の手に残るこの火傷は何の評価になるんだッ？！？！」
TextENG: ``How do you measure spirit? By difficulty?@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25700. By effort?@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25710. By sweat, or tears?@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25720. By its manifestation?!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25730. ...Then how would you rate these burns that are still on my hands?!?!``

TextJPN: 「わ、…圭一くん、それ……油が跳ねた火傷…？！」
TextENG: ``Wow... Keiichi-kun, those... Those are oil burns...?!``

TextJPN: 昨日の火事騒ぎの時の火傷痕が、いかにも料理にすごく苦労した風に見えてグッドだ。
TextENG: Great—the burn marks from when I almost caused a fire yesterday looked just like I was having a ton of trouble cooking.

TextJPN: 教室中も、俺の努力を認めないわけにはいかない様子がよくわかる！
TextENG: I could clearly tell that the classroom was forced to acknowledge the effort I put into it!

TextJPN: 「……ほぅ。@k@vS19/03/500300327.…自らの料理の下手さによる失敗を、さも努力の痕跡であるかのように見せるとは…。@k@vS19/03/500300328.やはりこの男、…油断ならない！」
TextENG: ``...I see.@k@vS19/03/500300327. ...To turn your failures at cooking due to lack of skill into scars of hard work instead...@k@vS19/03/500300328. As I thought... I cannot falter around this man!``

TextJPN: 「そうだ。俺は下手だ。昨日、大見得を切ったのが情けなくなるくらいに料理は下手だ。だが逃げなかった！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25750.　戦った！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25760.　そしてこの成果を出した！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25770.　それは心じゃないのか？！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25780.　どうなんだッ？！？！」
TextENG: ``That's right. I lack skill. I'm so bad at cooking that my grandstanding yesterday was pitiful. But I didn't run away!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25750. I fought!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25760. And I delivered these results!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25770. Is that not spirit?!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25780. What do you think?!?!``

TextJPN: 「レナは認めてあげたいな…！@k@vS19/02/500200433.　挑戦する心が評価されなかったら…誰も前に進めない！」
TextENG: ``Rena wants to acknowledge it...!@k@vS19/02/500200433. Nobody can keep on going... if their defiant spirit doesn't get valued!``

TextJPN: クラスの女子がうんうんと頷き始める。
TextENG: The girls in the class started to nod in agreement.

TextJPN: …よし！@k　追い風だ！！
TextENG: ...Okay!@k The tables are turning!!

TextJPN: だが、愛しき片思いの子たちに買収されている富田くん岡村くんも負けていない。
TextENG: But Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun, bought out by the objects of their unrequited affection, weren't about to lose either.

TextJPN: 明らかに買収分を超えて、俺への反撃に転じる！！
TextENG: They shifted to the counterattack, clearly exceeding the price they were paid!!

TextJPN: 「なるほど！@k@vS19/24/502400023.　前原さんの気持ちはわかります！@k@|@y@vS19/24/502400024.　ですがね、心だけで料理が決まるんだったら、この世にコックはいらないんですよ！」
TextENG: ``I see!@k@vS19/24/502400023. I understand your feelings, Maebara-san!@k@|@y@vS19/24/502400024. However, if spirit was all that mattered in cooking, the world wouldn't need chefs!``

TextJPN: 「そうっすよ。@k@vS19/25/502500019.心をこめて頑張りましたって言って、コックが消し炭みたいなハンバーグを持ってきたら、それにお金を払います？」
TextENG: ``That's right.@k@vS19/25/502500019. If a chef brought you burned steak and said they put their spirit into it and tried hard, would you pay them?``

TextJPN: 「払わないですよね？！」
TextENG: ``You wouldn't, would you?!``

TextJPN: 「つまりそういうことなんです！」
TextENG: ``It's the same thing!``

TextJPN: そうだそうだ、その通りだ！
TextENG: That's right, that's how it goes!

TextJPN: 男子生徒が富田岡村組の肩を持つ。
TextENG: The male students took Tomita and Okamura's side.

TextJPN: …ぐ、確かに一理ある。
TextENG: ...Gah, they did have a point.

TextJPN: 「でも心尽くしなんだぞ？！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25800.　たとえ真っ黒のハンバーグが出てきたにせよ！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25810.　それを作ってくれた母の苦労を知るなら、俺は食うッ！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25820.　完食してみせる！！」
TextENG: ``What about consideration?!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25800. Even if you did get a totally black steak!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25810. If I knew how much the mother who made it struggled, I would eat it!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25820. I would eat it all!!``

TextJPN: パチパチパチパチ！！
TextENG: Clap clap clap clap!!

TextJPN: 今度はクラス中の女子生徒が俺の肩を持ってくれた。@k…よし！@k　これで互角だ！！
TextENG: This time, the female students in the class took my side.@k ...Good!@k Now we're even!!

TextJPN: 「そもそもお弁当というのは愛情を食事のカタチとして昇華させたもので！！」
TextENG: ``Besides, a bento is a refinement of one's love given form!!``

TextJPN: 「それは相手に伝わって初めて意味があるんです。@k@vS19/25/502500023.前原さんのお弁当からはそれが伝わりますか？！@k@vS19/25/502500024.　いいえ、僕には伝わりません！」
TextENG: ``It only means something when the other person feels that way.@k@vS19/25/502500023. Does your bento make us feel that way, Maebara-san?!@k@vS19/25/502500024. No, it doesn't make me feel that way!``

TextJPN: 「「ひっどーーーーーーい！！！」」
TextENG: ``````You're meeeeaaaan!!!``````

TextJPN: クラス中の女子が今の発言に大ブーイングだ！@k　岡村くんもさすがに焦る。
TextENG: The girls in the class began to boo loudly at his remark!@k Now even Okamura-san was panicking.

TextJPN: 「あー、静粛に静粛に！@k@vS19/03/500300330.　傍観人は発言を慎むように！」
TextENG: ``Uhh, order, order!@k@vS19/03/500300330. Will the spectators please refrain from making remarks!``

TextJPN: 「裁判長！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25840.　俺はここで、この弁当にどれだけの『心』がこめられているかについて、料理学の権威、竜宮レナ氏の証言を求めます！」
TextENG: ``Your Honor!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25840. In order to prove how much of my spirit has gone into this bento, I call Ms. Ryuugu Rena, an authority in the culinary arts, to the stand!``

TextJPN: 「え、えー…っと！」
「レ、レナはこのお弁当には心がこもってると思うな！@k@vS19/02/500200436.　確かに稚拙なところは多いかもしれないけど…」
TextENG: ``R-Rena thinks this bento has spirit in it!@k@vS19/02/500200436. It might be rather artless in places...``

TextJPN: 「でも、お料理はうわべだけじゃないと思うの！」
TextENG: ``But I think cooking isn't just about outward appearances!``

TextJPN: 再び女子一同から大歓声と満座の拍手！
TextENG: The girls in the class again gave cries of support as they all applauded!

TextJPN: それに対し男子一同はブーイングだ！！
TextENG: In response, all the men in the class began to boo!!

TextJPN: 「さ、裁判長！@k@vS19/24/502400027.　前原さんと竜宮さんの意見は極めて感情的で、一般常識としてかけ離れています。@k@vS19/24/502400028.採用するには不適切です！！」
TextENG: ``Y-Your Honor!@k@vS19/24/502400027. The opinions of Maebara-san and Ryuugu-san are extremely sentimental, and aren't in following with common sense.@k@vS19/24/502400028. They are unsuitable to use as evidence!!``
``Order, order!!@k@vS19/03/500300332. The prosecution's objection is sustained.@k@vS19/03/500300338. Go ahead!``

TextJPN: 「おほん。@k@vS19/24/502400030.たとえば、本件をお弁当ではなく、誕生日のプレゼントだと置き換えて考えて見ます」
TextENG: ``Ahem.@k@vS19/24/502400030. Let's replace the bento in question with a birthday present, for example.``

TextJPN: 「たとえば、誕生日の日に、私、富田が手編みのセーターをもらったとする。@k@vS19/24/502400032.そして彼、岡村は図書券を一万円分もらったとする！」
TextENG: ``Let's say on my birthday, I, Tomita, received a hand-knitted sweater.@k@vS19/24/502400032. And he, Okamura, received a bookstore gift certificate for 10,000 yen!``

TextJPN: …やたらとリアルなたとえだな。@kそれ、本当にたとえか？
TextENG: ...That felt strangely real.@k Was it actually just an example?

TextJPN: 「常識的に考えて、どちらに心がこもっているかは明白です。@k@vS19/24/502400034.つまり手編みのセーター！」
TextENG: ``Common sense dictates which of them has the spirit.@k@vS19/24/502400034. It is, of course, the hand-knitted sweater!``

TextJPN: 「これはお弁当に言い換えれば、手作りのおかずが相当する！」
TextENG: ``If we went back to the bento, this would be handmade side dishes!``

TextJPN: 「そして、単なる金券に過ぎない図書券は、お金で買うもの、すなわち無味乾燥な缶詰に相当する！！」
TextENG: And the gift certificate, which is nothing more than money, allows you to buy things—in other words, it's the same as simple, meaningless canned goods!!``

TextJPN: ざわざわざわざわッ！！
TextENG: Murmur murmur murmur murmur!!

TextJPN: 男子女子入り乱れてのプレゼント論争だ。
TextENG: The boys and girls all began to argue amongst themselves about presents.

TextJPN: みんな、過去にもらったプレゼントは何だったかを語り合っている…！
TextENG: They were all talking about what they received as presents in the past...!

TextJPN: くそ…！
TextENG: Damn...!

TextJPN: みんなの関心を引きやすい話題にすりかえるとは…富田くん、…やるじゃねぇか！！
TextENG: Tomita-kun... He changed the subject to something that could easily grab everyone's attention... Not bad!!

TextJPN: このままじゃイニシアチブを奪われるッ！！
TextENG: I'll lose the initiative at this rate!!

TextJPN: 「異議ありッ！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25860.　本件はお弁当の心について問うものです！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25870.　誕生日のプレゼントという特殊な状況とはまったく異なりますッ！」
TextENG: ``Objection!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25860. This matter regards the spirit put into the bento!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25870. It is entirely different from birthday presents, as they are each unique situations!``

TextJPN: 「却下します。@k@vS19/03/500300335.検察側、続けなさい」
TextENG: ``Overruled.@k@vS19/03/500300335. Will the prosecution please continue?``

TextJPN: く、くそ！！
TextENG: D-Damn!!

TextJPN: 「さて。@k@vS19/25/502500026.ここで大事なのは、送り手の心と受け手の心はまったく違うという点です」
TextENG: ``Now then.@k@vS19/25/502500026. What's important here is the fact that the spirit of the giver and spirit of the receiver are totally different.

TextJPN: 「皆さんの目の前に実際に、手作りの、ちょっと左右の丈の崩れてるセーターと、一万円分の図書券が置かれていて、どっちがいいと聞かれたらどっちを取ります？！@k@vS19/25/502500028.　図書券でしょう？！」
TextENG: Between the handmade sweater that looks a little bit askew and the 10,000 yen book store gift certificate placed here before your very eyes, which would you say is the better choice?!@k@vS19/25/502500028. The gift certificate, right?!``

TextJPN: 「一万円ですよ一万円！！」
「コミックスが何冊買えるか計算できますか？！」
TextENG: ``Can you calculate how many comic books you could buy with that?!``

TextJPN: 「十数巻程度の単行本なら即座にフルコンプ可能です！！」
TextENG: ``You could instantly complete a full collection if it was around 10 volumes long!!``

TextJPN: 「愉快で面白おかしいマンガが何十冊…！！」
TextENG: ``Dozens of happy, humorous manga...!!``

TextJPN: 「これによって癒される心の至福とセーターでは比べ物にならないのです！」
TextENG: ``The bliss of your soothed heart can't be compared to the sweater!``

TextJPN: 男子たちが満場の拍手でそれを讃えた。
TextENG: The boys unanimously praised that with applause.

TextJPN: …即物的なヤツらめ…。@k…むぅ、だが、年頃の男なんてそんなもんだ。
TextENG: ...Materialistic brats...@k ...Mgh... But all guys that age are like that.

TextJPN: 俺だってセーターと図書券だったら図書券を選ぶもんなぁ…！
TextENG: Even I would choose the gift certificate over the sweater in that case...!

TextJPN: ってゆーかお前ら、最初は愛と心と味なんて言ってたじゃねぇかよ！！
TextENG: Hey, wait, weren't you guys the ones who said it was about love, spirit, and taste right at the start?!

TextJPN: いつの間にか味が全てだ！　なんて理論になってるしー！！
TextENG: Since when did taste trump all?! That's the stance they were taking now!!

TextJPN: 「以上より、送り手の心と、受け手の心には何の因果関係もないことが立証されたと思います。@k@vS19/24/502400036_04.…つまり！！@k@vS19/24/502400036_05.　前原さんがどれだけ苦労してお弁当を作ろうとも！」
TextENG: ``I believe this has demonstrated that the spirit of the giver and the spirit of the receiver have no causal relationship.@k@vS19/24/502400036_04. ...Yes!!@k@vS19/24/502400036_05. No matter how much Maebara-san struggled to make this bento!``

TextJPN: 「それは私たち受け手が採点に手心を加えるものにはなりえないのです！！」
TextENG: ``That cannot enter into consideration for the rest of us on the receiving end!!``

TextJPN: 「そ、それは詭弁だぞ富田くん！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25890.　心は確かにある！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25900.　それが伝わるかどうかは受け手の問題だ！！」
TextENG: ``M-Mere sophistry, Tomita-kun!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25890. It has plenty of spirit!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25900. Whether that gets through or not is the receiver's problem!!``

TextJPN: 「「そうよそうよ！！」」
TextENG: ``````That's right!!``````

TextJPN: 「「ブーーーー！！！」」
「「味が全てだ！！」」
TextENG: ``````Taste is most important!!``````

TextJPN: 「「女の敵ぃー！！」」
TextENG: ``````Enemy of women!!``````
``````What was that?!``````

TextJPN: あぁ、今や法廷は大混乱だ…！！
TextENG: Ah, now the courtroom is in chaos...!!

TextJPN: だが俺は負けるわけには行かない！！
TextENG: But I can't allow myself to lose!!

TextJPN: 罰ゲーム回避のためだけじゃない。
TextENG: And not only to avoid the punishment game.

TextJPN: 沙都子の…名誉のためにもッ！！
TextENG: But also... to protect Satoko's honor!!

TextJPN: 「さて。@k@vS19/03/500300337.弁護側は今のに何か反論はある？」
TextENG: ``Now then.@k@vS19/03/500300337. Do the defendants have a response to give?``

TextJPN: 俺はゆっくりと、…力強く頷いてから登壇する。
TextENG: Slowly and strongly... I nod, and step up to the dais.

TextJPN: 富田くん、岡村くん。@k……口先で、本当に俺に勝てると思ってるのかぁあぁあ…ッ！！！！
TextENG: Tomita-kun, Okamura-kun.@k ...Do you two... really think you can beat me with mere words...?!?!

TextJPN: 「今、検察側は、送り手の心とは無関係に評価が行われると言いました。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25920.それに間違いはありませんね？！」
TextENG: ``The prosecution just said that we should value the gift without basing it on the spirit of the giver.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25920. Correct?!``

TextJPN: …いつの間にか俺まで敬語だな…。
TextENG: ...At some point I began speaking formally...

TextJPN: 「えぇそうです！@k@vS19/24/502400038.　前原さんがどんなに苦労して作ったお弁当でも、その苦労は評価の対象にはなりえない！」
TextENG: ``Yes, that's right!@k@vS19/24/502400038. No matter how much you labored to make that bento, that labor should not factor into our grading!``

TextJPN: 「では検察側に尋ねます。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25940.私、前原が今日の自分の弁当として、このお弁当とコンビニ弁当を並べたら。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25950.その評価はどちらも同じものなのですか…？！」
TextENG: ``Then I have a question for the prosecution.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25940. If I, Maebara, were to take the bento I made for today and placed it beside one bought from the store...@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25950. Would both of these be given the same score...?!``

TextJPN: 検察側が言いよどむ。
TextENG: The prosecution hesitated to speak.

TextJPN: …もらったッ！！！
TextENG: ...Got you!!!

TextJPN: 「そうッ！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25970.　手作りの弁当とコンビニ弁当ではまったく比較にならないのです！」
TextENG: ``That's right!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI25970. A convenience store bento doesn't even come close to a homemade one!

TextJPN: 「どんなにひどい手作り弁当であっても、ただ買ってきただけのコンビニ弁当とでは比べ物にならないほどの心がこめられている！！」
TextENG: No matter how badly made it is, it has far more spirit than a bento that you just bought would ever have!!``

TextJPN: 「そしてそれは評価されている！！　つまり、手作りによる心は、ちゃんと受け手に伝わってるのです！！」
TextENG: ``You see, that spirit is being graded!! Meaning, the spirit the cook put into the bento has already reached the recipients!!

TextJPN: 「それを認めよッ！！！」
TextENG: ``Admit it!!!``

TextJPN: ドオオオォオォオンッ！！
TextENG: Booooommmm!!

TextJPN: 迫力の書き文字を背負って、指をさしてやるッ！！
TextENG: With those impactful words drawn in the air behind me, I pointed my finger!!

TextJPN: レナを筆頭に女子が大拍手だ！！
TextENG: The girls, led by Rena, broke into applause!!

TextJPN: 一部の男子も、それを認めかけているぞ！
TextENG: Some of the boys were admitting it, too!

TextJPN: 「認めましたね？！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26000.　認めましたね？！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26010.　では次にコンビニ弁当にはなぜ心がないかについて移りましょう。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26020.そもそも、弁当で伝える心とは何なのか？！」
TextENG: ``You admitted it?!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26000. You admitted it, right?!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26010. Then let's move to why a convenience store bento has no spirit in it.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26020. What exactly is the spirit in a bento in the first place?!``

TextJPN: 「い、異議あり！@k@vS19/25/502500039.　前原さんは抽象表現で法廷を煙に巻こうとしています！」
TextENG: ``O-Objection!@k@vS19/25/502500039. Maebara-san is trying to deceive the court by using abstract expressions!``

TextJPN: 「却下します。@k@vS19/03/500300339.面白そうだから最後まで聞くよーに」
TextENG: ``Objection overruled.@k@vS19/03/500300339. This sounds interesting, so listen until he's done.``

TextJPN: もらった。
TextENG: Got them.

TextJPN: ……今こそ、俺とお前らの格の違い、思い知らせてやるッ！！
TextENG: ...Now I'll show you two the difference between us!!

TextJPN: 「裁判長。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26040.ここで古手梨花氏を証人として喚問したいと思います！」
TextENG: ``Your Honor.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26040. I'd like to call Ms. Rika Furude to the stand as a witness!``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんもさすがに寝耳に水だったみたいだな。
TextENG: Even for Rika-chan, that must have seemed like a bolt from the blue.

TextJPN: まさかここで自分に矛先が向くなんて夢にも思わなかったに違いない。
TextENG: There's no doubt that she never dreamed the point of my spear would be aiming at her.

TextJPN: ……だが梨花ちゃん。@kさっき言ったよなぁ？！
TextENG: ...But Rika-chan...@k You said it before!

TextJPN: 「古手梨花さん。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26060.あなたの今日のお弁当は実によくできていますね。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26070.おいしそうです」
TextENG: ``Rika Furude-san.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26060. Your bento today was very well made.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26070. It looks delicious.``

TextJPN: そう。
TextENG: Yes.

TextJPN: 沙都子と梨花ちゃんの弁当は、富田くん岡村くんの弁当を半分拝借したものだ。
TextENG: Satoko and Rika-chan's bentos had been made of half of Tomita-kun's and Okamura-kun's.

TextJPN: 検察の富田くん岡村くんが血相を変えたが…もう遅い！！
TextENG: The prosecutors' faces turned pale... but they were too late!!

TextJPN: 「レナ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26090.岡村くんの弁当箱を持ってきてくれないか！」
TextENG: ``Rena.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26090. Would you bring Okamura-kun's bento over here?``

TextJPN: 「さ、裁判長！！@k@vS19/25/502500041.　本件に僕のお弁当は何の関係もありません！！」
TextENG: ``Y-Your Honor!@k@vS19/25/502500041. My bento has no relevance to this case!!``

TextJPN: 「裁判長、この岡村君の弁当箱を証拠品として提出しますッ！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26110.　見よ！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26120.　この中身をぉおおぉおッ！！！」
TextENG: ``Your Honor, I submit Okamura-kun's bento box as evidence!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26110. Look at it!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26120. Look at what's inside!!!``

TextJPN: 「むぅ。@k@vS19/03/500300343.…くっくっく、半分しか入っていないねぇ…！」
TextENG: ``Hmm.@k@vS19/03/500300343. ...Ku-ku-ku, there's only half in there...!``

TextJPN: 「半分かどうかじゃないでしょ、もっとよく見てください！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26140.　ほらッ！！！」
TextENG: ``It's not about whether there's half—please, look a little more closely!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26140. See?!?``

TextJPN: 「「ああぁ？！？！　まったく同じ内容だぁぁ！！！」」
TextENG: ````````Ahhh?!?! They're exactly the same!!!````````

TextJPN: 「裁判長、見ての通りです！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26160.　古手梨花氏のお弁当は岡村くんの盗品！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26170.　そんなものに心がこもってるわけがないッ！！！！」
TextENG: ``Your Honor, you've seen it!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26160. Miss Rika Furude's bento is stolen from Okamura-kun's!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26170. There is no way such a thing could have spirit in it!!!!``

TextJPN: 「い、いやこれは…、単なる偶然で……！！」
TextENG: ``N-No, but that's... just a coincidence...!!``

TextJPN: 「もう明白でしょう！！　心とは送り手と受け手のキャッチボール！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26190.　ならば弁当箱はボールに当たるのです！」
TextENG: ``It's already obvious! Spirit—it's a game of catch between the giver and the receiver!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26190. The bento box, then, is the ball!``

TextJPN: 「そして本来このお弁当は彼、岡村くんの母親から息子に託されたもの！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26210.　だからこの弁当箱に詰まった心は彼、岡村くんにしか受けられない！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26220.　それを割り込んで奪ったら……もうそれに心はないのですッ！！！」
TextENG: ``That bento was something Okamura-kun was given—from mother to son!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26210. That means Okamura-kun is the only one who can feel the spirit from this bento box!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26220. Now that it's been disturbed and been stolen... it no longer has that spirit!!!``

TextJPN: ドオオオォオオオォオォオンッ！！
TextENG: Dun-dun-duuuuuunnnn!!!
``Nipah~♪``

TextJPN: 「くっくっくっく。@k@vS19/03/500300345.……なるほどねぇ」
TextENG: ``Ku-ku-ku-ku.@k@vS19/03/500300345. ...I see how it is.``

TextJPN: 裁判長魅音が腕組をして唸り始める…。
TextENG: Mion, the judge, folded her arms and began to hum...

TextJPN: …この笑いの魅音では…何を考えているかなんて察しようもない。
TextENG: ...I couldn't even take a guess... as to what Mion was laughing about.

TextJPN: ズバリ、俺が負けるか俺が勝つか…わからない…！！
TextENG: Frankly, I didn't know... whether I would win or lose...!!

TextJPN: 「よし。@k@vS19/03/500300347.…判決の前に主文からにしようかね」
TextENG: ``Okay.@k@vS19/03/500300347. ...Before announcing my judgement, I'll start from the top.``

TextJPN: シン…。@k教室中が静まる…。
TextENG: Shh...@k The entire classroom quieted...

TextJPN: 「まず。@k@vS19/03/500300349.…被告、前原圭一の弁当が、客観的評価として非常に出来の悪いものであるのは間違いない。@k@vS19/03/500300350.それはこうして、みんなの採点の集計結果が物語ってるからね！」
TextENG: ``First.@k@vS19/03/500300349. ...From an objective standpoint, there is no doubt that the bento of the accused, Keiichi Maebara, must be seen as poorly-made.@k@vS19/03/500300350. This is something that the grading results clearly display!``
...Gah!

TextJPN: 「でも、圭ちゃんの言うとおり、料理は味だけじゃない。@k@vS19/03/500300352.心もまた、隠し味として認められるべきだよね。@k@vS19/03/500300353.でもそれは得点評価で言えば、小数点以下。@k@vS19/03/500300354.本当に微細なもので、その出来具合の評価を改めるには至らない」
TextENG: ``But as Kei-chan said, cooking is not all about taste.@k@vS19/03/500300352. The spirit put into it should be considered subtle seasoning.@k@vS19/03/500300353. For grading, though, that would only amount to a few points.@k@vS19/03/500300354. It's so subtle that it's not enough to alter the results.``

TextJPN: ……ぐぐ！
TextENG: ...Grrr!

TextJPN: 「さて。@k@vS19/03/500300356.ここでそもそもの今日の弁当勝負の原点を探りたい。@k@vS19/03/500300357.そもそも、今日の勝負は何が大前提なのか？」
TextENG: ``Now then.@k@vS19/03/500300356. I'd like to mention the original reason for today's bento showdown.@k@vS19/03/500300357. What was the reason for it?

TextJPN: 「そう。@k@vS19/03/500300359.被告、前原圭一が自炊できるか否かが問題になり、その成果を計る為に催されたものだった！」
TextENG: That's right.@k@vS19/03/500300359. We started it to see whether the accused, Keiichi Maebara, could cook for himself, and to measure the result!``
``Yeah.@k@vS19/02/500200445. That's right!@k@vS19/02/500200446. Keiichi-kun did make his own bento!``

TextJPN: …う。@kちょっぴり良心が痛むが、…うん、勝負は非情なのだ。
TextENG: ...Urk.@k That stung my conscience a bit... but for the showdown, it didn't matter.

TextJPN: 「ならば、この勝負の大前提は自炊！@k@vS19/03/500300361.　すなわち手作りであるか否かだよね！！」
TextENG: ``So, the whole basis behind this showdown was to cook a meal for yourself!@k@vS19/03/500300361. In other words, whether or not the meal was homemade!!``

TextJPN: 「でも、梨花ちゃんはそれを怠ったとなると…それは出来以前の問題！！@k@vS19/03/500300363.　すなわち…失格ってことになるのかなッ？！？！」
TextENG: ``Rika-chan neglecting to do that... is a much bigger problem than how good her bento is!@k@vS19/03/500300363. In other words... is she disqualified!?!?``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんはにぱ～と笑って、梨花ちゃんなりに覚悟を決めたように見える。
TextENG: Rika-chan let out a nipah~, looking as though she had prepared herself for this outcome.

TextJPN: 「わ、悪く思うなよ梨花ちゃん。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26240.部活は非情なのだ」
TextENG: ``D-Don't take it personally, Rika-chan.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26240. At our club, things like that don't matter.``

TextJPN: 「……さすが圭一なのです。@k@vS19/05/500500179.最後の最後まで頑張りましたですよ」
TextENG: ``...Keiichi did well, like I thought.@k@vS19/05/500500179. You tried your hardest until the very end.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんは俺の頭をねだり、なでなでをした。
TextENG: Rika-chan demanded I lower my head, then she pet it.

TextJPN: 「というわけで、これにて一件落着ッ！！！@k@vS19/03/500300365.　今日のビリは…古手梨花ぁぁ！！！」
TextENG: ``With that over with, this case is closed!!!@k@vS19/03/500300365. Today, last place goes to... Rika Furudeeee!!!``

TextJPN: 「「うをおおおぉおっぉぉおおぉお…！！！」」
TextENG: ````````Woooooooooaaaahhh...!!!````````

TextJPN: 奇跡の大逆転劇！！！
TextENG: That miraculous turnaround!!!

TextJPN: しかも…ビリは…絶対に考えられなかった梨花ちゃん！！
TextENG: And... last place went to... Rika-chan, the one everyone had least expected!!

TextJPN: 教室中がざわめく！！！！
TextENG: The whole classroom went wild!!!!

TextJPN: 「…ふ、ふん。@k@vS19/04/500400355.よくもこんなひどいお弁当でビリを免れましたのね」
TextENG: ``...H-Hmph.@k@vS19/04/500400355. I'm amazed you managed to avoid coming in last place with such a terrible bento.``

TextJPN: 沙都子が憎らしい顔をしながら、だけど曖昧な声でそう言った。
TextENG: Satoko looked at me hatefully, but spoke in a vague kind of voice.

TextJPN: 「ビリになんかなるわけないだろ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26260.この弁当のどこにビリになる要素があるってんだ」
TextENG: ``There's no way I'd come in last.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26260. There's nothing in this bento that would deserve last place!``

TextJPN: 「だ、…だってだって！@k@vS19/04/500400357.　こんな、…出来の悪いお惣菜や缶詰ばっかりで…センスもなくて……それからそれから……！」
TextENG: ``B... But!@k@vS19/04/500400357. It's all... poorly made side dishes and canned goods... and has no style... and, and...!``

TextJPN: がし！！
TextENG: Grab!!

TextJPN: だんだん自虐的になっていく沙都子の頭を乱暴に掴み、わしわしと撫でてやった。
TextENG: Satoko was speaking more and more poorly of herself as time went on—so I roughly grabbed her head and began to stroke it.

TextJPN: 「言ったろ？！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26280.　心が大事だって。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26290.この弁当はうわべだけじゃない、いろんな味に溢れてるんだぜ？！」
TextENG: ``I told you!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26280. Spirit is important.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26290. This bento isn't all about appearance—it's got all kinds of flavors in it!``

TextJPN: 「でも…心だけじゃありませんのよ…！！@k@vS19/04/500400359.　お味なんて…全然ヘンで……」
TextENG: ``But... Spirit isn't the only thing...!!@k@vS19/04/500400359. It tastes... totally weird, and...``

TextJPN: 「どこがヘンなんだ！！　俺はうまい！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26310.　うまかった！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26320.　だから詰めてきた！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26330.　本当に昨夜のメシがまずかったら詰めてなんかこないぞ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26340.食パンと牛乳パックを持って登校してくる！！」
TextENG: ``What about it is weird?! I thought it was great!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26310. It was absolutely great!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26320. That's why I packed it!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26330. If dinner last night had been bad, then I would never have brought it to school.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26340. I would have come here with some bread and a milk carton!!``

TextJPN: 「……えっと、……で、…でもでも…ッ！！！」
えぇい、もう黙れ。
TextENG: Oh, just shut up already.

TextJPN: 頭をブンブンと振るように、わしわし撫でてやる。
TextENG: I caressed her head, swinging it from side to side.

TextJPN: いつの間にか、そんな俺たちの後ろにレナが来ていた。
TextENG: At some point, Rena had come up behind us.

TextJPN: くすくすと笑っている。
TextENG: She was giggling to herself.

TextJPN: …初めから全部知ってたって顔だな。
TextENG: ...That was the face of someone who had known everything from the beginning.

TextJPN: 「いつ頃から俺が作ったんじゃないって気付いてた？」
TextENG: ``When did you realize I hadn't made it?``

TextJPN: 「圭一くんが火傷を見せてくれた時かな？@k@vS19/02/500200448.　だって、圭一くんのお弁当に油で炒めるおかずなんか入ってないし…！」
TextENG: ``When you showed us your burns, I guess?@k@vS19/02/500200448. I mean, there's nothing in your bento that you needed oil for...!``

TextJPN: 「……えっと、えっと…！@k@vS19/04/500400362.　レナさんは何か誤解してるではございませんの？！@k@vS19/04/500400363.　わ、私は別に何も…！」
TextENG: ``...Umm, err...!@k@vS19/04/500400362. Rena-san, don't you think you are misunderstanding something?!@k@vS19/04/500400363. I-I didn't do anything...!``

TextJPN: 「あれ？@k@vS19/02/500200450.　このお弁当、沙都子ちゃんが作ったんじゃないんだ？@k@vS19/02/500200451.　じゃあやっぱり圭一くんの手作りなのかな？@k@vS19/02/500200452.　うん。@k@vS19/02/500200453.じゃあ圭一くんの手作りなんだね」
TextENG: ``Huh?@k@vS19/02/500200450. Satoko-chan, you weren't the one who made this bento?@k@vS19/02/500200451. Then did Keiichi-kun make it by himself after all?@k@vS19/02/500200452. Okay.@k@vS19/02/500200453. Then I guess he did.``

TextJPN: レナは悪戯っぽく笑いながら、沙都子から俺に向きを変えた。
TextENG: Rena smiled roguishly and turned from Satoko to me.

TextJPN: 「キュウリとかを切るときは、包丁をほら、こんな感じで引くの。@k@vS19/02/500200455.彩りなんかはね、お野菜を上手に加えるといろいろ表現ができるんだよ！」
TextENG: ``When you cut cucumbers, you hold the knife like this, and go like this.@k@vS19/02/500200455. As for the colors, you can express all sorts of things if you place vegetables in the right way!``

TextJPN: …そのレクチャー、明らかに俺にしてるものじゃないよな。
TextENG: ...This lecture was clearly not meant for me.

TextJPN: 「でも、前に見せてもらった時よりも、ずっと上達してたよ。@k@vS19/02/500200457.ちゃんとお勉強してるんだね！@k@vS19/02/500200458.　きっとこの調子なら、もっともっと上手にお料理が作れるようになるよ！」
TextENG: ``But you've gotten a lot better since the last time you showed us.@k@vS19/02/500200457. I see you've been studying!@k@vS19/02/500200458. If you keep this up, I bet you'll be able to make better and better dishes in no time!``

TextJPN: と、明らかに沙都子を対象にした言葉を、俺に対して言う。
TextENG: She continued saying words clearly meant for Satoko while facing me instead.

TextJPN: …沙都子は、曖昧な顔で相槌ひとつ満足に打てないでいた。
TextENG: ...Satoko was wearing an ambiguous look, and couldn't even nod her head at her.

TextJPN: 「とにかく誰が何と言おうと！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26370.　俺は今日の弁当を気に入ってるんだ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26380.今日ばかりは誰にも分けないからな！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26390.　俺がひとりで全部食うッ！！」
TextENG: ``Anyway, no matter what anyone says!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26370. I like the way my bento is today.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26380. I'm not gonna share it with anyone else, either!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26390. I'll eat the whole thing by myself!!``

TextJPN: 「わ、ケチなんだ…！」
TextENG: ``Wow, how greedy...!``

TextJPN: 「レナも食べてみたいな！　みたいな！」
TextENG: ``Rena wants to try some too! Too!``

TextJPN: そんなやりとりをしていると、沙都子が眠い時に目を擦るような仕草をしてから、魅音とみんなに告げた。
TextENG: As we were going back and forth, Satoko rubbed her eyes as though she was drowsy, then announced to Mion, and everyone else:

TextJPN: 「あ、あの…私も実は！@k@vS19/04/500400365.　…富田さんにお弁当を分けてもらいましたの！」
TextENG: ``E-Excuse me... The truth is...!@k@vS19/04/500400365. ...I got Tomita-san to give me some of his bento!``
``Stupid!@k@vS19/24/502400042. ...Houjou, what are you saying...?!``

TextJPN: 内緒にしていれば、少なくとも沙都子だけは助かったのに…。@k富田くんが無念と驚きの入り混じった顔を向けた。
TextENG: If she'd kept it a secret, then at least she would have been saved...@k Tomita-kun looked at her with an expression filled with regret and surprise.

TextJPN: 魅音はクルクルと指を回してから廊下を指差し、沙都子にも罰ゲームを宣告した。
TextENG: Mion spun her finger around, then pointed to the hallway, sentencing Satoko to the punishment game as well.

TextJPN: 沙都子はまるで、梨花ちゃんのお使いに付き合うかのような気さくさで、教室を後にする。
TextENG: Satoko left the classroom behind her, completely prepared, as though she was going with Rika-chan on an errand.

TextJPN: 「…梨花だけに行かせられませんわ。@k@vS19/04/500400367.地獄の底までお付き合いしましてよ」
TextENG: ``...I can't let Rika go alone.@k@vS19/04/500400367. I will accompany her to the very depths of hell.``

TextJPN: 「……そんなとこまで付いて来なくていいのですよ」
TextENG: ``...You don't need to go that far.``

TextJPN: 「まったく圭一さんも嫌味ですわね！@k@vS19/04/500400369.　梨花だけをさらし者にするなんて、本当に意地悪な人でございますこと！」
TextENG: ``My word, Keiichi-san really is terrible, too!@k@vS19/04/500400369. Humiliating only Rika like that—he is truly a rotten person!``

TextJPN: 別にそんなつもりじゃ…。
TextENG: I didn't mean...

TextJPN: ただ俺は、弁当の恩を仇で返すわけにはいかないと思って……。
TextENG: I couldn't just return Satoko's kindness with malice...

TextJPN: 「……ね？@k@vS19/05/500500182.　本当に沙都子はお馬鹿さんなのですよ」
TextENG: ``...Hey?@k@vS19/05/500500182. Satoko really is silly.``

TextJPN: にっこりと笑いながら、梨花ちゃんは俺だけに聞こえるように、そう言った。
TextENG: Rika-chan spoke so that only I could hear, grinning happily.

TextJPN: 「では！@k@vS19/04/500400371.　そろそろ行きましてよ梨花！@k@vS19/04/500400372.　罰ゲームも部活メンバーの務めでございますわー！！」
TextENG: ``Now then!@k@vS19/04/500400371. Let us be off, Rika!@k@vS19/04/500400372. Punishment games are one of our duties as club members!!``

TextJPN: 沙都子は何だが嫌に嬉しそうで、いつも負けた時に見せるような、悔しそうな仕草は一切なかった。
TextENG: Satoko seemed awfully happy—not frustrated in the slightest, like she always was when she lost.

TextJPN: ……ちぇ。
TextENG: ...Damn.

TextJPN: …確かに梨花ちゃんの言うとおりだな。@kどいつもこいつも馬鹿ばっかだ！
TextENG: ...Rika-chan's right after all.@k Everyone here is a moron!

TextJPN: 「魅音！　俺も白状するぞ！！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26410.　今日の弁当は俺が作ったんじゃない！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26420.　俺も同じだ！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26430.　だから行ってくるぞ！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26440.　罰ゲーム！！」
TextENG: ``Mion! I'll come clean too!!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26410. I didn't make my bento today!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26420. I was the same!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26430. So I'm going with them!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26440. For the punishment game!!``
``Huh!?@k@vS19/03/500300371. Even you, Kei-chan!?@k@vS19/03/500300372. W-What's going on...!?``
``Uhuhuhu!@k@vS19/02/500200462. Good luck!@k@vS19/02/500200463. With the punishment game, I mean!@k@vS19/02/500200464. I'll get the first aid kit ready.``

TextJPN: 「…予め救急車の手配を頼む。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26460.場合によっては霊柩車だな…」
TextENG: ``...Call an ambulance in advance, will you?@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26460. And maybe a hearse, just in case...``

TextJPN: 目を白黒させている魅音と、嬉しそうに笑うレナを教室に残し、廊下へ出た。
TextENG: Leaving a bewildered Mion and a happily-smiling Rena behind in the classroom, I went into the hallway.

TextJPN: 「……な、…何やってるんですの？！@k@vS19/04/500400374.　せっかく勝てたのに！@k@vS19/04/500400375.　わざわざ罰ゲームに名乗りをあげるなんて、物好きにもほどがあるでございましてよ？！」
TextENG: ``...Wh-What are you doing?!@k@vS19/04/500400374. You finally won for once!@k@vS19/04/500400375. I had no idea you had such an odd taste for these punishment games that you'd go so far as to volunteer yourself for one!``

TextJPN: 「そうだな。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26480.物好きにもほどがあるぜ」
TextENG: ``Guess so.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26480. It's a little much for a hobby, eh?``

TextJPN: 「…まったく！@k@vS19/04/500400377.　今日の罰ゲームを甘く見過ぎですのよ？！@k@vS19/04/500400378.　私たちならともかく、圭一さんじゃあ、大変なことになってしまうかもしれませんわね！@k@vS19/04/500400379.　肋骨の一本や二本の覚悟はおありでしょうねぇ！」
TextENG: ``...I swear!@k@vS19/04/500400377. I think you're underestimating this one!@k@vS19/04/500400378. We're one thing, but grave harm might actually befall you, Keiichi-san!@k@vS19/04/500400379. I hope you're ready to have one or two ribs broken!``

TextJPN: 「う、…肋骨は痛そうだな…。俺、痛いのはダメなんだ…」
TextENG: ``Urgh... That sounds like it would hurt... I don't like getting hurt...``

TextJPN: 「圭一さんは大人しく、私の相槌を打っているんですのよ？！@k@vS19/04/500400381.　私と梨花でうまくやりますから！@k@vS19/04/500400382.　まったく！@k@vS19/04/500400383.　罰ゲームの面倒まで私が見なくちゃダメなんて…まったく！」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-san, you just stand there and nod along, okay?!@k@vS19/04/500400381. Rika and I will smooth it over!@k@vS19/04/500400382. I swear!@k@vS19/04/500400383. I can't believe I have to look after you even during a punishment game... Seriously!``

TextJPN: …この不機嫌そうな素振りは、実はとても機嫌がいいものなのはもう知ってる。
TextENG: ...I already knew that her pouty behavior was a sign that she was actually in a really good mood.

TextJPN: だから、微笑ましかった。
TextENG: So it made me want to smile.

TextJPN: 俺は沙都子に顔を向け、そして言った。
TextENG: And so I turned to Satoko and said...

TextJPN: 「なぁ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26510.またいつか、作ってくれよな？」
TextENG: ``Say.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26510. Would you mind making that again sometime?``

TextJPN: 「弁当。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26530.……うまかったよ」
TextENG: ``That bento.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26530. ...It was great.``

TextJPN: 「あんな程度が私の腕と見くびられては困ります。@k@vS19/04/660400110.今度はもっとすごいのを作って差し上げますわっ！」
TextENG: ``Such a measly bento isn't indicative of my cooking skill.@k@vS19/04/660400110. Next time I will make you something much more impressive!``

TextJPN: 「私、もっともっと上手くなって、今度こそ圭一さんをうならせてみせますわよ。@k@vS19/04/660400112.文句なしに満場一致で優勝を――」
TextENG: ``I'm going to get much, much better. And next time, I will make you groan in defeat,@k@vS19/04/660400112. and have you declare me the unanimous vic――.``

TextJPN: 俺は沙都子が言い終わらないうちに、頭をわしわしとなでてやった。
TextENG: I gave Satoko a rough pat on the head before she was even finished talking.

TextJPN: 「昨日の夕飯もうまかった。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26550.沙都子の作るものは、何でもおいしいよ」
TextENG: ``Yesterday's dinner also tasted great.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26550. Anything you make is gonna be delicious.``

TextJPN: 「………………お、お惣菜屋さんと缶詰屋さんに、そっくりそのまま伝えておきますわ」
TextENG: ``.........I-I'll make sure to tell that to the supermarket I bought the side dishes and canned meals from.``

TextJPN: 沙都子は投げつけるように言うと、スタスタと歩いていく。
TextENG: Satoko said in a sharp tone and briskly walks away.

TextJPN: 「素直にほめさせてもらえないのが、沙都子のかわいいとこなのです。@k@vS19/05/660500089.にぱ～☆」
TextENG: ``Not being able to take a compliment is one of the cute things about Satoko.@k@vS19/05/660500089. Nipah~☆``

TextJPN: 「梨花、余計なことは言わないでいいのでございますわっ！」
TextENG: ``Rika, you need not add such frivolous remarks!``

TextJPN: そんな会話をしながら歩いていれば、職員室の戸はもう目の前だ。
TextENG: Such was our conversation as we walked until we found ourselves in front of the teacher's lounge.

TextJPN: 「さて！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26570.　罰ゲーム、みんなでやれば怖くない！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26580.　行くぜっ！」
TextENG: ``Now then!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26570. This penalty is nothing to be afraid of if we do it together!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26580. Let's go!``

TextJPN: ガラーーリッ！！！
TextENG: Slaaaam!!!

TextJPN: 今、死の世界の扉を開くッ！！
TextENG: We opened the doorway to the world of death!!

TextJPN: 知恵先生は……毎日間違わずに、お日様が東の空から昇るように。
TextENG: And like she did every day, just as the sun rose in the eastern sky...

TextJPN: …今日もカレー弁当を食べていた。
TextENG: Chie-sensei was eating curry for lunch.

TextJPN: レトルトだが、毎日違う銘柄なのがポイントだ。
TextENG: It was store-bought, but she made a point of eating a different brand every day.

TextJPN: 「あら。@k@vS19/22/661400005.前原くんに古手さんに北条さん。@k@vS19/22/661400006.……どうかしましたか？」
TextENG: ``Oh, my.@k@vS19/22/661400005. Maebara-kun, Furude-san, and Houjou-san.@k@vS19/22/661400006. ...Is something the matter?``

TextJPN: 大好きなカレーを口いっぱいに頬張って至福のひと時みたいだ。
TextENG: She appeared to be in the middle of a moment of supreme bliss, her mouth full of her beloved curry.

TextJPN: ……それにケンカを売るなんて、何て罪な罰ゲームだろう？
TextENG: ...And we were to pick a fight with her—what a crime this punishment game would be!

TextJPN: でもやらなければならない！
TextENG: However, it was what we had to do!

TextJPN: それが…我が部の掟だからだッ！！
TextENG: For that... was the rule of our club!!

TextJPN: 「…じゃあ行くぜ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26600.いいか？」
TextENG: ``...All right, let's do this.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26600. Ready?``

TextJPN: 「圭一さんは仕切らないで下さいませ。@k@vS19/04/660400116.ここは私たちにお任せなさい！」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-san, you needn't take charge.@k@vS19/04/660400116. We will take care of this!``

TextJPN: わ、わかった…………。
TextENG: S-Sheesh, fine......

TextJPN: 「……ファイト、おーですよ」
TextENG: ``...Go for it, yay.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんが『にぱ～っ☆』と微笑んでみせる。
TextENG: Rika-chan smiled with a ``nipa~h☆``.

TextJPN: よし、覚悟は決まった。後は２人についていく！　沙都子、梨花ちゃん…………俺の命、預けたぞ！
TextENG: Alright, I've made up my mind. I'll follow their lead! Satoko, Rika-chan...... My life is in your hands!

TextJPN: 沙都子と梨花ちゃんが、すぅ…と息を深く吸い込む。……それから…、
TextENG: Satoko and Rika take a deep breath. ...And then...

TextJPN: 「や、やーいやーい！　カレー独身貴族、ニンニク臭いぞ～～～～ッ！！！！」
TextENG: ``H-Hey, you over there! You stuck up curry snob, you're single because you smell like garlic!``

TextJPN: 知恵先生の目が、急激に冷たいものへと変わってゆく。心なしか、職員室の室温までもが氷点下レベルに下降したような…………い、いや！　絶対下がってるぞこれは！？
TextENG: Chie-sensei's eyes suddenly turned cold. Somehow, even the temperature of the room itself felt like it went below freezing...... W-Wait! It *is* freezing?! Why?!

TextJPN: 沙都子と梨花ちゃんの姿はとっくに目の前から消えていた。
TextENG: Satoko and Rika-chan had already long disappeared from my sight.

TextJPN: …………消えていた？
TextENG: ......They're gone?

TextJPN: 「――――前原くん、よく聞きなさい」
TextENG: ``――Maebara-kun, listen carefully.``

TextJPN: ゆっくりと、スローモーションのようにゆらぁり、と立ち上がると知恵先生は、足音も立てず瞬間移動で俺にシュパパパ――――ンッッ！！　と迫り、鼻先約３センチの距離に顔を近づけて言った。
TextENG: Chie-sensei sloooowly stands up, as though she were in slow motion. She then teleports in front of me until she's about three centimeters in front of my face.

TextJPN: 「あ、あのあのあの、そのぉ…………っ！？」
TextENG: ``E-Erm, um, um, I can expl―!?``

TextJPN: 「あなたは、３つの間違いを犯しました。@k@vS19/22/661400012.ひとつ、カレーの悪口を言ったこと。@k@vS19/22/661400013.ふたつ、カレーの悪口を言ったこと。@k@vS19/22/661400014.そしてみっつ――@k@vS19/22/661400015.カレーの悪口を言ったことっっ！！！」
TextENG: ``You've made three mistakes.@k@vS19/22/661400012. The first was that you badmouthed curry.@k@vS19/22/661400013. The second that you badmouthed curry.@k@vS19/22/661400014. And the third...@k@vS19/22/661400015. was that you badmouthed curry!!``

TextJPN: ３つじゃなくて、１つじゃないですかっ！？
TextENG: Isn't that just *one* mistake?!

TextJPN: ――なんて、心に思っても言えるわけもなく、俺は。
TextENG: ――Is what I would love to say out loud, but there's no way I can.
``I-I'm sor...... HRHY?!``

TextJPN: 「いい言葉を、教えてあげましょう――」
TextENG: ``There's a great saying for situations such as this――``

TextJPN: 「な、なんでしょおかっ？」
TextENG: ``A-And what might that be?``

TextJPN: 「こぼれたカレーは、元には戻らない」
TextENG: ``Spilt curry will never go back to normal.``

TextJPN: …………その後のことは、思い出したくもない。つーか、聞かないでくれ。
TextENG: ......I don't want to remember what happened after that. Just don't ask.

TextJPN: 素敵過ぎる体験をして教室に戻った俺を、みんなはとても生温かく出迎えてくれた。
TextENG: When I came back to the classroom after my lovely experience, everyone gave me a warm welcome back.

TextJPN: 「お～、お疲れさん！@k@vS19/03/660300246.　よく戻ってこれたね～？」
TextENG: ``Wow~ Good job!@k@vS19/03/660300246. I'm amazed you got back alive.``

TextJPN: 「圭一さんは反応が遅すぎますわ！@k@vS19/04/660400120.　ヒット＆アウェイは戦術の基本ですわよ！！」
TextENG: ``You just reacted too slowly!!@k@vS19/04/660400120. When it comes to tactics, Hit and Run is like the basics of the basics!!``

TextJPN: 「……ひとり取り残されてかわいそかわいそなのです」
TextENG: ``...Poor Keiichi, left all alone by himself.``

TextJPN: いつものように高笑いの沙都子と、慰めなのか馬鹿にしてるのか頭を撫でてくれる梨花ちゃん。俺はばったりと倒れ伏した身体を起こし、さっさと逃げ去った二人にジト目を向けた。
TextENG: As usual, Satoko was engaged in her haughty laughter while Rika-chan patted me on the head to either comfort me or make fun of me. I raise up my collapsed body and glare at the pair that ran away.

TextJPN: 「に、逃げるなら先に言ってくれ……！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26680.　それとも俺は捨石か！？」
TextENG: ``W-Why don't you tell me that the plan is to run...?!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26680. Or what, am I a sacrificial pawn to you?!``

TextJPN: 「何を言ってるのでございますか！@k@vS19/04/660400122.　だから私たちに全てお任せなさいませ、と何度も申し上げたではありませんか！？」
TextENG: ``What are you talking about?@k@vS19/04/660400122. How many times did I tell you to leave things to us?!``

TextJPN: 「ボクたちの動きをちゃんと見ていれば、逃げるタイミングが何処にあるのかわかったはずなのです。@k@vS19/05/660500094.――圭一はボクたちではなく、知恵を見てしまったのが失敗なのですよ」
TextENG: ``You would've known the time to run, had you looked at us more closely.@k@vS19/05/660500094. ――Your mistake was that you looked at Chie, not us.``

TextJPN: そんなことを言われても……フツー見てしまうだろ、相手の顔を！？
TextENG: Easy enough for you to say... Isn't it normal for me to look at the person we're dealing with?!

TextJPN: 「顔と目を見ると、人間は萎縮してしまうものなのです。@k@vS19/05/660500096.全体を見て相手の動きを見れば、おのずと隙は見つかるものなのですよ」
TextENG: ``People tend to shrink back when they look at someone's face or eyes.@k@vS19/05/660500096. If you want to find an opening, you need to look at their entire body and track the entirety of their movements.``

TextJPN: 「梨花ちゃん……それは剣の達人の技だよ……？」
TextENG: ``Rika-chan... I think you're describing how to be a master swordsman...``

TextJPN: 「いっぱいいっぱい勉強ができてよかったのです。@k@vS19/05/660500098.これで圭一も、次からは大丈夫なのですよ。@k@vS19/05/660500099.にぱ～☆」
TextENG: ``I'm glad you got to learn so much.@k@vS19/05/660500098. Now you'll be just fine next time.@k@vS19/05/660500099. Nipah~☆``

TextJPN: にこやかに笑ってみせる梨花ちゃん。……というか、次どころかこんな体験をするのはもう二度とごめんだ。
TextENG: Rika-chan gives me a pleasant smile. ...Which is nice, but I never want to go through that again.

TextJPN: 「……にしても聞いたよ、圭ちゃん。@k@vS19/03/660300248.今回の昼食、結局沙都子たちの力を借りたんだって？」
TextENG: ``...I heard, by the way, Kei-chan.@k@vS19/03/660300248. You ended up getting help from Satoko for lunch, didn't you?``

TextJPN: ニヤリと笑いながら、魅音はやれやれと肩をすくめて見せる。どうやら戻った沙都子と梨花ちゃんが、事のあらましを二人にも説明したようだ。
TextENG: Mion grinned while giving me a playful shrug. Looks like she got the gist of what happened from Satoko and Rika-chan when they got back.

TextJPN: 「まぁ、放っておいてもよろしゅうございましたけどね！@k@vS19/04/660400124.　少しは思い知らせてあげたのでございますわ！」
TextENG: ``Well, I didn't care much about helping him!@k@vS19/04/660400124. I just decided to show him just who he's dealing with!``

TextJPN: 「……ボクたちがいなければ、今ごろ前原屋敷は炭焼き屋敷に変わっていたのです」
TextENG: ``...If it weren't for us, the Maebara mansion would be the mansion of Ashes right about now.``

TextJPN: そ、それは秘密にしてくれってあれだけ頼んだじゃないかぁぁっっ！！？
TextENG: I-I asked you so many times to keep that a secreeeeet!!

TextJPN: 「あ――っはっはっはっはっ！@k@vS19/03/660300250.　面白い、面白いよ！@k@vS19/03/660300251.　やっぱり圭ちゃんは面白いね！！@k@vS19/03/660300252.　生粋のエンターティナーだよ！！」
TextENG: ``Hahahahaha!@k@vS19/03/660300250. That's funny. That's so funny!@k@vS19/03/660300251. You really are funny, Kei-chan!@k@vS19/03/660300252. You're a natural entertainer!!``

TextJPN: 「……体張ったエンターテイメントは見て楽しむもんだ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26700.やっても全然つまらんわっ！！」
TextENG: ``...I'm sure you take great joy in watching other people's suffering.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26700. But as it turns out, it's not fun for the person suffering!!``

TextJPN: 「まぁ、それは置いといて……@k@vS19/03/660300254.どう？@k@vS19/03/660300255.　今日もおばさんいないんでしょ？@k@vS19/03/660300256.　ここはひとつ、おじさんがヘルプに行ってあげようか？@k@vS19/03/660300257.　ん？」
TextENG: ``Well, let's set that aside for now...@k@vS19/03/660300254. So?@k@vS19/03/660300255. Your mom won't be home again today, right?@k@vS19/03/660300256. How about this old man help out today?@k@vS19/03/660300257. Hm?``

TextJPN: 「え、いいのか？@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26720.　そりゃ助か――――、あ」
TextENG: ``Huh, you sure?@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26720. That'd be gr―― Ah.``

TextJPN: 一瞬、喜びかけた俺だったが。
TextENG: For a brief moment, I was about to express joy.

TextJPN: 魅音の向こうに見える、沙都子と目が合って……思わず、口をつぐんだ。
TextENG: But then my eyes met with Satoko's when I looked past Mion... and I instinctively held my tongue.

TextJPN: 沙都子の、なんとも形容しがたい複雑な表情。
TextENG: Satoko's expression was indescribably complicated.

TextJPN: さっき、『また食べたい』と俺が気軽に言った言葉を、沙都子はきっと覚えているだろう。もしかしたら今日も、晩御飯を作りにきてくれる心積もりで、いてくれていたのかもしれない……。
TextENG: I bet Satoko still remembers the comment I casually made about wanting to eat her food again. It could be she was fully prepared to make dinner for me again today...

TextJPN: だったら、今日は――――。
TextENG: In that case, I'll choose――

TextJPN: 「――――それはいい考えでございますわ！@k@vS19/04/660400127.　魅音さんのお料理をご賞味できるなんて、圭一さんには一生分の果報かもしれませんけどね～～？」
TextENG: ``――What a wonderful idea!@k@vS19/04/660400127. This could be your once in a lifetime chance to get to appreciate Mion-san's cooking!``

TextJPN: 俺が魅音の申し出を断る前に、沙都子が笑顔でそう後押しする。そして、俺のほうに振り返ると沙都子は、からかうような笑みを満面にして言った。
TextENG: Before I could turn down Mion's offer, Satoko encouraged the idea with a smile. She then looked back to me and grinned teasingly.

TextJPN: 「圭一さん、ぜひ感謝してお引き受けなさいまし！@k@vS19/04/660400129.　どうせ今日はため置きのカップラーメンをお食べになるつもりだったのでございましょう？@k@vS19/04/660400130.　比べ物になりませんわよ～？」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-san, please do graciously accept her offer.@k@vS19/04/660400129. You were planning on eating those instant noodles today anyway, right?@k@vS19/04/660400130. That's not even close to what Mion-san is offering.``

TextJPN: 比べ物に、ならない。
TextENG: It's not even close.

TextJPN: それは、きっと自分の料理のことも指しているのだろう。
TextENG: I bet she's implying the same about her own cooking.

TextJPN: でも俺は、あんなにも美味しかったんだぞ？　そんな風に卑下しないでも……。
TextENG: But I enjoyed it soo much! There's no need for her to belittle herself...

TextJPN: 「よ～し、決まりだね！@k@vS19/03/660300259.　それじゃ、買い物してから圭ちゃんの家に行くから待ってて――、」
TextENG: ``All ri~ght, it's settled then!@k@vS19/03/660300259. I'll go shopping and then visit Kei-chan's house, so just wait for me and――.``
``...Hau~, Mii-chan.@k@vS19/02/660200313. Why not look at all 360 degrees of the world around you...``

TextJPN: 「……誰か魅ぃに空気の読み方を教えてやって欲しいのです。@k@vS19/05/660500102.がお～」
TextENG: ``...I do wish I could teach her how to read the room.@k@vS19/05/660500102. Rawr~``
``R-Rawr...?@k@vS19/03/660300263. And what do you mean, ``read the room``?``

TextJPN: 「……もうゴールしてしまいなさいなのです」
TextENG: ...It means, score your point and be done with it.

TextJPN: 「なぁ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26750.俺さ、野菜炒めが食いたいんだけど、…沙都子、作れるか？」
TextENG: ``Hey.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26750. I do want to eat some vegetable stir-fry... Satoko, can you make that?``

TextJPN: 「え、と、…まぁ、頑張れば出来ないことはありませんわよ！」
TextENG: Err... Well, there's nothing I can't do if I put my mind to it!``

TextJPN: 「……上手に作れますですよ。@k@vS19/05/500500184.沙都子の野菜炒めは大好きなのです」
TextENG: ``...She can make it very well.@k@vS19/05/500500184. I really like Satoko's stir-fry.``

TextJPN: 初めは不安げだったが、梨花ちゃんのお墨付きがもらえると、沙都子は自信を取り戻した眼差しで俺に振り返った。
TextENG: She was uneasy at first, but once she got assurance from Rika-chan, she turned back and looked at me with once-more confident eyes.

TextJPN: 「じゃあ決まりだな。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26770.今日、学校が終わったら、いろいろ買い物に行こうぜ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26780.俺じゃあ、何を買えばいいのか、全然わかんないし」
TextENG: ``It's settled, then.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26770. Let's go shopping for stuff after school today.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26780. I don't really have any idea what to buy, after all.``

TextJPN: 「それもそうですわねぇ。@k@vS19/04/500400387.圭一さんじゃあ、スーパーでお買い物なんて、まだまだ早いでしょうし！@k@vS19/04/500400388.　私が見てなければ不安ですからねぇ！」
TextENG: ``That is true, isn't it?@k@vS19/04/500400387. I think it's still too early for you to go shopping at the supermarket, Keiichi-san!@k@vS19/04/500400388. It would make me anxious if I wasn't watching!``

TextJPN: 「……その沙都子も、ボクが見てないと間違えたお買い物をしちゃうんじゃないかと不安なのです」
TextENG: ``...And Satoko makes me anxious that she'll buy the wrong thing if I'm not watching.``

TextJPN: 「り、梨花ぁ！！」
TextENG: ``R-Rikaaa!!``

TextJPN: なんて、そんな会話をしながら歩いていれば、職員室の戸はもう目の前だ。
TextENG: The conversation continued as we walked, until we arrived before the door to the teacher's lounge.

TextJPN: 「さて！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26800.　罰ゲームなんかちゃっちゃと済ませて、今晩の献立の話でもしようぜ！」
TextENG: ``Okay!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26800. Let's get this punishment game over with and discuss the menu for tonight!``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんが嬉しそうに、腕に組み付いて来た。@k…なので、もう片方の手で沙都子の肩を抱き寄せる。
TextENG: Rika-chan gleefully grabbed onto my arm.@k In turn, I pulled Satoko to me, grabbing her shoulder with my other hand.

TextJPN: 「死ぬときゃ、みんな一緒だぜ？@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26820.　誰も一人でなんか死なせない！」
TextENG: ``We'll all be together in death!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26820. I won't let anyone die alone!``

TextJPN: 「……みんなで一緒です。@k@vS19/05/500500189.誰も一人でなんか死なせないのです」
TextENG: ``...We're all together.@k@vS19/05/500500189. I won't let anybody die alone.``

TextJPN: 「ふ、不謹慎な話ですわねぇ！@k@vS19/04/500400391.　私はそんな物騒なの御免ですわよ！！」
TextENG: ``W-What an indiscreet thing to say!@k@vS19/04/500400391. I want no part in something so disturbing!!``

TextJPN: とか不機嫌にいいながら。@kこいつ、照れるくらいに嬉しそうにしてやがる。
TextENG: She may have sounded annoyed...@k but she was so happy it was gonna make ME blush.

TextJPN: 「よし。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26840.この扉、一枚向こうは死後の世界だぞ！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26850.　みんなで戻るぞ！@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26860.　みんなでだ！！」
TextENG: ``All right.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26840. Just beyond this door is the world after death!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26850. However, we shall return!@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26860. All of us will!!``
``Yes!!@k@vS19/04/500400393. Everyone will!!@k@vS19/04/500400394. Then... let us sally forth!!``

TextJPN: ガラーーリッ！！！
TextENG: Slaaaam!!!

TextJPN: 今、死の世界の扉を開くッ！！
TextENG: We opened the doorway to the world of death!!

TextJPN: 知恵先生は……毎日間違わずに、お日様が東の空から昇るように。
TextENG: And like she did every day, just as the sun rose in the eastern sky...

TextJPN: …今日もカレー弁当を食べていた。
TextENG: Chie-sensei was eating curry for lunch.

TextJPN: レトルトだが、毎日違う銘柄なのがポイントだ。
TextENG: It was store-bought, but she made a point of eating a different brand every day.

TextJPN: 「あら。@k@vS19/22/501400061.前原くんに古手さんに北条さん。@k@vS19/22/501400062.……どうかしましたか？」
TextENG: ``Oh, my.@k@vS19/22/501400061. Maebara-kun, Furude-san, and Houjou-san.@k@vS19/22/501400062. ...Is something the matter?``

TextJPN: 大好きなカレーを口いっぱいに頬張って至福のひと時みたいだ。
TextENG: She appeared to be in the middle of a moment of supreme bliss, her mouth full of her beloved curry.

TextJPN: ……それにケンカを売るなんて、何て罪な罰ゲームだろう？
TextENG: ...And we were to pick a fight with her—what a crime this punishment game would be!

TextJPN: でもやらなければならない！
TextENG: However, it was what we had to do!

TextJPN: それが…我が部の掟だからだッ！！
TextENG: For that... was the rule of our club!!

TextJPN: ３人でもう一度硬く肩を抱き合う。
TextENG: The three of us held each other's shoulders tightly once more.

TextJPN: 「…じゃあ行くぜ。@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26880.いいか？」
TextENG: ``...All right, let's do this.@k@vS19/01/HR_KEI26880. Ready?``

TextJPN: 「圭一さんは大人しくしてるんですのよ！！@k@vS19/04/500400397.　全て私と梨花でやりますから！！@k@vS19/04/500400398.　私に今だけ命をお預けあそばせ！」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-san, you're going to stay quiet!!@k@vS19/04/500400397. Rika and I will handle everything!!@k@vS19/04/500400398. Entrust your life to me for now!``

TextJPN: 「……ファイト、おーですよ」
TextENG: ``...Go for it, yay.``

TextJPN: 先生の頭にクエスチョンが２つ３つと並んでいるのが見て取れる。
TextENG: We could see two or three question marks popping up above the teacher's head.

TextJPN: じゃあ沙都子。
TextENG: All right, Satoko.

TextJPN: 俺の命、今だけ預けるからな。@k…俺は目を固くつぶって、今夜の食事のことだけ考えてるからな…！！@k　頼むぜ…！！！
TextENG: This is the only time I'll trust you with my life.@k ...Because I'll be shutting my eyes tightly and only thinking about what we'll be having for dinner...!!@k I'm leaving it to you...!!!

TextJPN: 沙都子が、すぅ…と息を深く吸い込む。@k……それから…、
TextENG: Satoko inhaled deeply.@k ...And so...

TextJPN: 「や、やーいやーい！　カレー独身貴族、ニンニク臭いぞ～～～～ッ！！！！」
TextENG: ``H-Hey, you over there! You stuck up curry snob, you're single because you smell like garlic!``
